What a terrific experience!!

My 9 year old son has been raving about this place after attending this year's burger brawl and dining there twice with his dad. He claimed that their pork roll burger was "the best burger he's ever had" and the Blue Duck fries were terrific. We've been wanting to check it out but just haven't made the effort until today...and are we glad we did!

We were under a time constraint as we couldn't get there before 5:00pm and my son had a batting lesson at 7:00pm in the same neighborhood. Thinking a Friday night may be popular, I went on open table to book a reservation for 5:00pm. Unfortunately, the only availability was 4:15 or 4:45pm so we were just going to go elsewhere. I decided to call and check on the odds of us getting a table without a reservation just in case. I spoke to a super nice fella who told us to come at 5:00 and we would be ok.

The atmosphere was terrific and the staff, welcoming! The menu had so many tempting selections but we were inclined to try the burger on my son's suggestion. The pork toll burger was delicious as were the blue duck fries and the brussel sprouts! My cousin had the wild boar meatloaf which she loved as well. I can't wait to go back!!!

More than the food, the best part of the night was when the gentleman I spoke to on the phone earlier came to check on us even inquiring about the baseball lesson I mentioned. That personal attention will guarantee my return!!! 

Thank you for a wonderful experience!! We will be back and will tell our friends about you as well!!

What a gem!  Excellent food and service. Duck fries were delish!  I had the pimento chicken wrap which was a great combo of grilled chicken, pimento cheese spread, avocado and bacon.  My friend had the General Taos tacos. I snagged a bite. What a explosion of flavor.

Our new favorite date place. Have been here so many times and cannot beat the food and service. Specials always amaze me with amazing food combinations. Sitting at the counter watching the chefs prepare is always interesting. I always leave full and happy.

The first time we went was for brunch. It was okay I won't be back for brunch. The menu was too different for me, I like classics. 

We came back for lunch another time, great decisions. The duck fries were amazing! We had the wings, the general Taos were a little too sweet for me but still good. They were pretty meaty wings too. 

The wait staff does forgot about you a lot and it's s small place, doesn't make sense. But the food is good, can't wait to try dinner there

Been here only once with my wife. Had a slight problem with my dish and manager corrected it and offered to replace it with something else. Very professional and friendly service. Will come back again. BTW the DUCK fries and Mac n cheese are BOMB.

Great find. I signed up for Yelp just to be sure others know about this place. We were a party of five and we all enjoyed our entrees. My nephew said it was the best burger he has had. I had a fish dish with roasted winter veggies which was outstanding. BYO which is great. We live in Montgomery Co so it's a bummer it is so far away!!!

Everything you may have heard and more...

Came out on my day off with a friend who saw the chefs in action at a Philly Cooks event. We grabbed duck fries and split two burgers. While I've never been a huge fan of fries, their duck fries had me locked. Full of taste with every bite, we didn't leave a single fry behind. The house special duck sandwich was awesome, yet overshadowed by the special venison burger we also split. 

Working in the northeast I never knew this gem existed. It's also s BYO! Learn from my mistake and take a trip out to eat here soon!

We have visited Blue Duck about 3 times. It's a great concept in dining. A small restaurant but does a very good job on accommodating it's customers. The food is always great, and consistent. We tell everyone about The Blue Duck. There is plenty of parking and you will definitely leave full!

I think this place is entirely too good for Northeast Philly. Its hidden in a run down small shopping center. But I guess the Northeast needs nice things too... I guess. I wish this restaurant was closer to me. The service was AMAZING.... at times a little too eager (I kept getting asked how everything was as I was having a conversation with my friend) But I understand that is what happens at a newer restaurant that wants to please their customers. 

We ordered the General Tso wings (DELICIOUS!!!!!) I regretted splitting them with my friend because I wanted all of them. We also split the Duck Fries, which were really good, I loved the way the potatoes were cooked not to mention the shredded duck and cheese. Lacking a bit of salt for my taste but what do I know. My friend ordered the Wild Boar Meatloaf, I tasted it and was extremely jealous that I didn't order that. That is until I tasted my Pork Roll Burger topped with a fried egg. YUM!!! like YUM!!!! I mean seriously YUM!!!! It didnt need anything. It was perfect and I was tempted to save a piece and try to reverse engineer it. Not really... but REALLY. 

Blue Duck is a little out of the way, We made a trip specifically to come here, but if you are in the NE and want an amazing Center City experience, I would definitely give it a try. Apparently the owners wanted it in that neighborhood because that is where they grew up, and their childhood school is right across the street from the Restaurant. 10 points for giving back to their neighborhood!

My girlfriend and I have been here a bunch of times, but I've never got around to posting a review. Simply put, The Blue Duck is awesome. We've ordered pretty much everything on the menu and have been satisfied every time. I keep going back wanting to get the pork roll burger again and again, but can't pass on the creative specials of the day. The menu has a little something for everyone, from wings and fries to pasta and fish. It's evident that the chefs do their homework, especially when you see the plating and take the first bite. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and I think they do a really great job for being a fairly new restaurant. I would recommend making a reservation most of the time, but sitting at the counter isn't bad either. I have to make it here for brunch! Excellent food, BYO, great price, and relaxed atmosphere. I will definitely continue to be a patron here.

Service was great. Very knowledgeable and friendly waitress! Food was amazing! Had to try the duck fries everyone raves about and didn't disappoint. Duck salad was so fresh and light. Food was amazing. Will be coming back since menu changes every week.

Ugh, I have mixed emotions about this place. We called at 10:30 and asked if they were on a wait for brunch. The girl stated we could sit at the farm table if we can right in. We arrived at 10:50 and we were told a 40 minute wait. We were told that the farm table was being held for a 12:00 reservation. Didn't make much sense but rather then argue we waited a bit. Now we had a toddler with us and we were sat at the bar. I wanted to walk out then. Sitting on a stool with no back, that's not really safe. But they had to hold the table 1:10 minutes before the party arrived.

This was our first time here and we've been waiting to try it for some time. The waitress was awesome, very pleasant and great. We went with the porkroll egg rolls, general tso wings and the short rib quesadilla. The egg rolls were good, nothing really special. They were a bit skimpy on the sriracha ketchup. The wings, not good at all. The sauce was good but the wings were small and a bit undercooked. $9.00 for 6 small wings is a ripoff. The quesadilla by far was the best part. It was perfect! I would highly recommend that.

I wouldn't return. The reservation and seating situation is a joke. The food was just okay. 2 stars, one for quesadilla and one for service. People throwing out 5 stars for this place is absurd.

I was having a hard time deciding if I wanted to give them 3 or 4 stars. The first visit to the Blue Duck we had a reservation for 6 people and still waited an hour for our table to become available. It was when they first opened so they were still working out the kinks. Everyone thought their food was decent but wasn't anything spectacular. The sweet potato gnocchi was not good at all. 

Last week we decided to give them another shot. We made another reservation for 6 and we were seated within 10 minutes. It was surprisingly busy for a Tuesday night. For starters we ordered the quack and cheese which was AMAZING. We also had the general tso wings(they were okay) and the duck fries(pretty good). Their special that night was lobster tacos which sounded amazing. Three of us ordered them but the waiter had to come back and tell us that they were all out which was a bit disappointing. The other three ordered the pork roll burger. It was pretty good, a little over seasoned to me. 

The main reason that I decided on 4 stars is that this place is great FOR THIS AREA. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. There aren't many good food places in the Northeast so compared to their competition, they are a 4. I will definitely eat here again if I feel like staying local.

Would definitely go back- we ordered the following
1. Blue Duck Fries: 8 out of 10
2. Duck mac n cheese: 5 out of 10 (maybe try a more flavorful cheese! not a ton of flavor on this!)
3. Beast of the east burger: 10 out of 10 (tomato jam is stupid delicious and the combo of boar and beef is just ridiculously good. The brioche bun is great not too greasy. Easily one of the best burgers I've ever had)
4. Fried chicken: 10 out of 10- the cheesy collard greens were amazing! The chicken was crispy without being overly greasy, perfect amount of savory saltiness with a little kick. Best fried chicken 

Restaurant is a bit small and very loud- they have music playing somewhat loud- could do without the music since its so small and can get so loud- this is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.A cute vibe, with a great theme- duck in many apps and entrees. Love this place!

So happy that NE Philly now has this cozy, cute, hip restaurant we can go to for brunch or dinner. It's a small and almost not noticeable from the outside, but stylish and modern from the inside. You feel like you are in center city, without having to drive the CC :-) love it! Went there for Sunday brunch and the place was packed. Food was creative and delicious and coffee was awesome! It's hard to get great coffee served anywhere anymore. Keep up the good work and we will be your loyal customers and supporters! 
Couple comments: Could you please add hooks under the counter for purses and jackets. And fresh orange juice for brunch on the weekends would complete our experience for us. Thank you!

My friends and I had Sunday Brunch here for the first time and well we plan to go back time and time again.  I had what I can only describe as heaven on earth, the Frankenwaffle. It is a Belgian waffle topped with 2 sunny side up eggs, a large piece of scrapple, and smothered in melted Vermont cheddar cheese with a sprinkle of diced chives. I also shared an order of the Stocks Pound Cake French toast which is topped with whipped cream, chocolate chips, and maple syrup, also extremely delightful. The atmosphere was casual and quaint and the service was great. The Chef came over and made sure that everyone was happy. This place is a real gem!

Went to this place for lunch with my sister and this little HITW at a small plaza was excellent! The atmosphere inside is so quaint and bright that you feel so at home there. The food was also amazing. We ordered the duck fries and honestly between the two of us, that one order of fries was enough to fill us up even before the entrees came! They were delicious and I am actually craving them at this moment.

The burger and macaroni and cheese were also excellent! The burger was great, but nothing out of this world. HOWEVER, the macaroni and cheese was amazing! When it came to the table we expected it to be really heavy, but surprisingly, it was really light yet very flavorful. I would definitely order it again next time :)

I was tempted to give this place three stars...but then I realized that I can't really fault them for being too far from my home and office for me to be able to eat there for lunch every day.

I honestly couldn't imagine a better place for lunch. A BYOB where I can get high-quality sandwiches, wings, and mac & cheese? Fries covered in shredded duck and gouda? Munchie heaven. Fortunately, this place is as good in practice as it is on paper. Service was incredibly friendly, food was prompt, and I thought the price was very reasonable given the quality and quantity of food.

Fantastic experience!! Highly suggest you come check this place out if you're looking for some place new.

Very unique for the area and it was very refreshing not having to eat at one of the chains. 

Food was delicious. Cheesecake was killer (and I don't usually like cheesecake.)

I've been back to this place twice in hopes that the service would improve. The food is great quality, the kind of food you would expect in the city. But the service is well below average. Our first visit was for lunch, and the waitress did not make us feel welcome, very uncomfortable to order a drink and seemed annoyed. Second visit was for dinner on a Saturday night. Again food was great, spent $75 on apps and dinner for 2... It was so rushed that we were out of there in 20 minutes with an hour to kill before going to our comedy show. I guess because it is so small they need a fast table turn over time, but I don't care for feeling like I'm being rushed out the door. Again, it's a foodies dream for north east philly. But the service needs work.
This place is a gem in this part of Philadelphia. The food is so tasty I wish I could eat here daily. The burgers are really good and they have duck fries and tater tots!

This place is in an unassuming strip mall in the northeast. The food was great but the music was a bit too loud to enjoy conversation. My fear is that it won't last in the northeast which is better known for chain restaurants. It seems like a better fit for the northern liberties or art museum area. 

It's a small place but the food is great, albeit a little pricey for a lunch spot.

My visit to the blue duck was fantastic. The food was great , very flavorful and portioned perfectly . I just wanted to make a few notes on the staff . For starters , the host in the plaid shirt attempted to sit me in the rest room , claiming "tables are being reserved" . He also continued to push chicken salad on me after 4  pm. Next the gentleman in a fedora hat continued to stare at his phone and posting ridiculous puns to the social media pages , he looks as if he isn't dedicated enough . The gentleman working the expo station had a nice salmon colored shirt on , I feel as if he had the same shirt on my last visit the night before Halloween . The small Hispanic man working the fryer slowly became one with the wall while he was leaning against it , he continuously made parfaits despite no one asking for them . The grill guy was awesome , there is even a bobble head made of him . They kept calling him "Johnny mods" due to his close eye to sandwich modifications . The other two white guys were very quiet and the one left early for a party. The younger chef working saute station had hair as perfect as his technique...... Talk about seduction ! Most of the dish crew looked young and frail , very little potential . All and all I love this place , despite the mason jars they serve coffee in . I will be back , thanks blue duck

I had the chorizo Mac and cheese I enjoyed my meal this was the 2nd time that I've ordered it. My wife can't recall what she ordered that's how unmemorable it was. Her review is around here somewhere. But she didn't enjoy her meal either. We were using a gift certificate and gave this place 2 tries. We won't be returning.

Great food and amazing service ! It was a special night for me and my mom - I emailed them with a special request/ surprise for my mommy and they did everything very nice . Replying really quick to emails and being very accommodating. You'll need a reservation though , even on a Wednesday they are full !

My wife and I decided to try this place after we kept hearing about this place.. So glad we did! The place is very small and intimate .. My wife and I started out with the duck fries.. They were delish! Soo amazingly good.. My wife wanted to try their signature pork roll burger.. It was very tasty.. I had to have a bite.. Really good.. I got their special pan seared barramundi with wild rice..OMG never tasted anything like it!  I had unsweetened iced tea and she had a coke.. It's BYOB .. Next time we will bring one since tonight was a spur of the moment to go.. Staff was very nice and friendly.. Everyone was really nice.. This will be our new place to go to.. We want to sample everything on the menu..loved it here.

This place was horrible from the food to the service.  Food came out cold when we told the server someguy came over with an attitude saying he was the owner and if we didn't like it we could leave . I will never go or recommend to anyone . DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND AVOID!

Been here twice for lunch.  Both times shared the Blue Duck fries, which are very delicious, though the cheese could be more flavorful (maybe a sharp cheese mixed in) and the fries less greasy.  There's a puddle in the bottom of the tray when they're done.  The flavored teas and lemonades are good.  The first sandwich I had was the fried chicken sandwich.  The chicken, while it tasted good, wasn't cooked well.  It was hard on the end that was thin and not cooked the whole way on the thick end, so maybe trimming the pieces to be more uniform would help. The big chunks of hard red cabbage were impossible to eat. A pickled cabbage slaw that has finer pieces would be a lot better.  The second sandwich I had was the portobella sandwich.  Again, it tasted really good but the execution was not so good.  It was difficult to eat and just made a mess.  Sprinkling corn and black beans all over a sandwich just leads to them all falling out.  There's no friction on the smooth mushroom, so everything basically just squeezes out when you try to bite in to it.  The greens, which were listed on the menu as kale but seemed to be broccoli rabe, were burned and had stalk material which was sort of tough.  I assume they were sauteed rather than braised as the menu stated, because they were blackened and crispy in parts.

The place has a nice, clean, country decor.  But, it's crazy loud in there.  The (I presume) manager that stopped by said after we mentioned that that they're adding carpet to the underside of the tables and counters so hopefully that will help.  It wasn't even full and was too loud...I can't imagine a full, BYO dinner night.

Overall, pretty good and definitely a good addition to an area that has next to nothing for decent food options that aren't chains or bar food.  I'll definitely go back and hopefully get there for dinner some time.
Visiting from west coast and was recommended to go here. Delicious duck fries and Chicken ceasar salad. Highly recommended!

This is really 3.5 stars but without fractions, it's not worth 4.  

To start off we had to sit outside.  That's fine, but the three goofy weirdos that came in a min after us were able to eat at the bar  (it wasn't offered). It was windy and pouring out.  An overhang only does so much.  

The food was good but not enough to write home about it good (is that an applicable old-timey saying?).  I was told the Jawn burger was award winning... why?  "How would you like your burger?" "Medium"  Comes out with no pink whatsoever.   Come on man, you want the title, live up to it.  Still searching for the best burger in the city, like Marshall Erickson.


Duck fat fries were very good.  Quack and cheese was very good.  Wings were decent.   Again, I'm not understanding all the 5/5 reviews though. 

Waitresses.  Nice girl that forgot about us most of the meal.  Dude,  if I only drink water and I have to come inside to ask you to fill our glasses, come on now.  We had to come in to get you to take our order.  We had to come in to get your to give us the check.  15% was generous in my opinion as we are 20-25% all day (when you remember your patrons. ..)


That's it really.  Chalk it up to a bad rainy day, I don't know.   As we are in plymouth meeting, I can't see driving past Lucky's Last Chance and a ton of better places to get good food but average service

Made reservations for dinner couple weeks back. The restaurant isn't big and we were seated kind of right the middle, wasn't my preference as I felt we were in the open and wanted a more private and intimate feel but food was worth it. 

The restaurant is BYOB and we brought a bottle of wine they put it right on ice and accommodated us. 

For appetizers we ordered the General tso buffalo wings and duck fries as we have heard nothing but greatness. These dishes were both really good. General tso wings tasted great not exactly how I imagined but no disappointment. Wasabi blue cheese was mild and yummy too. Then the duck fries were simply divine. 

Entrees we ordered meatloaf, pork roll burger and fried chicken. The meatloaf was wrapped in bacon and the bacon didn't seem to provide much as the texture of the bacon was extremely soft (I like a lil more crisp) and I wind up taking it off as I felt it didn't add much to the flavor profile. The meatloaf was good but I don't think I'd order it again. Mashed potatoes were on point. My daughter got the fried chicken and it was amazing. Perfect crisp the honey like sriracha taste was good and the Swiss chard with it was so creamy and yummy I am copying this recipe to make at home. Mac n cheese that accompanied it was also good. The pork roll burger was good too. I would get that or try a different one again!  We all then split chocolate cake and that was good too. Another cool thing is they serve glass bottle soda. If you are going to order a soda it always tastes better in glass bottles. 

Staff are excellent. I love they serve high quality food but aren't pretentious like some nicer restaurants. You can see they work as a team and have fun doing it. This makes me want to patron them more. They are northeast Philly's diamond in the rough as you don't expect this quality of food in a strip mall around Holme circle!  I know their CC location is opening up soon...hopefully they keep this spot open too!
The atmosphere is great and I feel at home! Quack and cheese was delicious! Duck fries were tasty! Friendly services...definitely recommend!

I was pleasantly surprised to find this gem in the northeast on the way to my parents house. 
I was looking for a spot to eat that could also accommodate my somewhat finnicky eater of a princess 9 year old daughter. While they don't specifically have a kids menu, our server, I believe her name was Jennifer, was very helpful deciding what to choose. Jennifer was happy to offer their Mac and cheese as a keyed down version without all the bells and whistles and provided a delicious, cheesy version that appeased my lil Isabella gleefully. Bella also enjoyed the fresh cut French fries as well. I know not the most nutritious meal in the world but sometimes happiness trumps nutrition. 
To be continued...
I've been here a couple of times other than the tables being so close together this place is great. The food is very good and the staff very attentive and friendly.

I've only been here once and it was not that pleasant of an experience. Our waitress was nice and attentive initially, though ten minutes into our visit I felt we were completely forgotten. The space is small, very homey and nicely decorated, though there is not much elbow space. The duck fries were tasty, though the lack of drinks available when I went didn't allow me to compliment them with anything besides water or unsweetened tea. I definitely would like to revisit and give this place another shot.
Just left, cool space, very accommodating and excellent service.  food was great too! The Blue Duck Fries are a must have! Will definitely be back soon to try the daily specials.
Excellent food and service! We arrived a little early and they still took great care of us.
Ill keep the updates short. The second visit was just as  great as the first. The Pork Roll Burger was ..just..there are no words..but perfection comes to mind. Its a must try.
Duck fries are so delicious and the portion is huge! Enough to split with 4 people. The staff goes above and beyond to make sure you're satisfied with everything.

The food was amazing but the service was awful. All our meals came out a different times so one person would be finished eating before the others had their food. Another note I asked for a soda and a cup (since it came in a bottle) and had to get the glass myself along with a straw because the waitress didn't return until 30 minutes later (also without a cup). Maybe if you come here on a tuesday afternoon the service may be better but I probably wont be returning.

The duck fat fries are a must! As well as the classic or duck mac n cheese, or the Blue Jawn burger, or every flavor wing! This BYOB is incredible! It reminds me of something that you'd come across in NoLibs or Center City but it's in the Far NE and even better... it is walking distance from my house! If you aren't walking distance from here then simply take the 20 or the 50 and it stops right there! 5 star food, service and convenience!

Made the trek out to the northeast a few months back and WOW was it worth it!

The blue duck friends which are tossed in duck fat, smoked Gouda cheese sauce, shredded duck and scallions are amazing!!! must order this

The award winning pork roll burger was out of this world, ground pork roll and beef patty, cooper American, sunny side up egg, sriracha mayo on a potato roll....unbelievable!

Only suggestion for this would be if a better roll/bun was used.

Also, the coffee is quite tasty as well.

Please check this place out as you won't be disappointed.

Everything I have tasted so far was good at this cafe! It's definitely the best comfort food around in that location! The menu is pretty much set so the options of trying things that are reviewed well is only if you show up on certain days or timings, that was the only issue I had but I guess that's strategic!
Fresh quality food. Delicious, prepared right in front of you. Customer service AMAZING. The team is very friendly. Will be returning. Compliments to the chefs.

I always enjoy eating here. Doesn't matter if we eat in or order for take out, the service is outstanding. Very professional, friendly and attentive. The food is always on point and delicious. Keep up the good work. Always a good day for the Duck.

Had their seasonal candy cane French toast pancake thing. Phenomenal. Life changing. 

Their chicken croquets were probably the best I ever had. 

Their wings were good. General tso wings were my favorite. Buffalo wings could be spicier. The Dick fries were different and I like them, but not something I could binge on cause they're so heavy.

Service is great. It gets extremely busy and packed but all the servers move efficiently. 

My little cousin dropped blue cheese on the ground and everyone, including the chefs, all said we didn't need to clean it up cause we were guests when we tried to wipe it off. Great crowd!!

Great to have this place in Northeast near my house. Duck fries were awesome as was the Classic Mac n Cheese. Chilean Sea Bass fish tacos were different and a real treat. Love this place, you can get a great salad, Mac and cheese, burgers on the less expensive side, and also enjoy some excellent fine dining with more expensive items. Something for everybody.

The Blue Duck is always my go to choice for a good lunch or dinner! The atmosphere is perfect & the food is always amazing. The special menu changes every so often to leave room for even more choices. Go here & you won't be disappointed!

Unacceptable. Paying 16 plus tax on some sub-par, unseasoned, UNCOOKED food. Sriacha buttermilk and Tabasco honey?!?! They must have forgot that too, no heat whatsoever. Had high hopes with all the comments saying they belong downtown. Saturday's are usually the A-team. They couldn't hack it downtown or SP.

My best friend and I decided to visit Blue Duck that we heard so many great things about! We know this is a popular restaurant in the NEAST (to where we grew up) we are currently in the Port Richmond area and my best friend and I gave them a call due to her having to work at 3pm. We called and asked how long the wait would be, the host said 10 minutes and then she can seat us. So we decided to give it a go being that it was 12, we drove up. Assuming they were saving us a seat being that she told us to come in. We get there and then they said they sat a couple at our table. No worries she said it would only be a few minutes, and 40 minutes later we get sat at the breakfast bar. We were greeted by a lovely waitress who took our order right away. My best friend got her meal within 30 minutes, she ordered breakfast corn dogs, bacon and the potatoes . I ordered the chicken and waffles. Her food came out before mine and 30 minutes after she was done her meal, I received mine. Our waitress was so nice and waived it from our bill. I really do enjoy the vibe there, I do understand it was a brunch but the hosts need to be more on top of things. The service was amazing and the food was to die for but the waiting game is what put a funky taste in my mouth. I give blue duck 4 stars! Everything about it is great!

One of my favorite restaurants. They construct new American dishes that just make sense. Duck confit fries are bomb. The only issue that they don't have any competition in area, so the restaurant has not really innovated lately. I enjoy sitting up on the bar so I can watch the boys work. For brunch, definitely get the poundcake french toast.
I love this place. It's nice to see quality restaurants with great food in the greater Northeast. The menu doesn't disappoint, the staff is friendly and the ambience overall is very welcoming.

It's a tiny place in a strip mall...but as soon as you walk in, you know it's going to be awesome because it smells sooo good. The menu was pretty simple but everything was so flavorful and delicious. I got the fried chicken...I'm still thinking about it!

Love this little cozy place. Very cute inside, their food is very fresh! Had salmon and Benedict egg for my breakfast. Loved it! Little potato knishes are very delicious! I'm not big on sweets, but presentation of their little pastries is very appealing.
Style in and out, menu selection and presentation reminds me of the Europe. Go there and enjoy!

Went for Sunday Brunch. Can't say enough good things. The food was delicious and the service was on point.i suggest the fries in duck fat with smoked Gouda - you won't be disappointed!! I had the special, but can't want to go back and try the stocks French toast

My boyfriend and i went to the blue duck last Saturday after knowing so many people who went and loved it! I also wanted to try it because I much rather support local business than go into the city. 

My biggest complaint wasn't necessary the food, although there were some disappointing aspects. Although we voluntarily opted to sit at the counter, it should be noted that the seats are extremely uncomfortable, and if you are going to have patrons wait relatively long for appetizers and dinner there should be better seating. I only say this because it distracted us from enjoying the atmosphere. 

Now on to the food. Obviously the duck fat fries were fantastic! We also got the bruschetta wings which my boyfriend loved. He got the blue duck sandwich and said it was good. I got the turkey burger, which was decent, lacking flavor on burger. The avocado was nice and the bacon crispy. I also got the cheesecake for dessert which was amazing, probably the highlight of the meal. 

My one last comment is that a guy siting next to is sent his food back because part of the dish was cold, although the dish was supposed to be cooked and served that way. However, since the kitchen is open to the table top seating the cook got annoyed and began to make faces and mumble under his breath. You cannot allow criticism, such as that to bother you especially when your patrons are right in front of you. It was a little upsetting to see and made me feel bad for the man sending back his food. The server was great and said she would comp the meal and if he wanted anything else, but the man declined. 

Overall, I will most likely be back and try a special, but I think most of these things are growing pains of a new restaurant and will work themselves out in due time.
This place raises the bar for restaurants in the Northeast! Great food and the atmosphere is Center City without the traffic. It can get loud.
Delicious food, clean and friendly atmosphere. Great lunch and dinner selections. Love the duck fries and burgers!

I've been waiting forever for a place like this in the northeast! With the quality of food, you can't beat the prices and the fact that it's BYO. I've eaten here three times, and so far some menu items are 5-star, out of this world delicious (the Pork Roll Burger, the Quack & Cheese, the Blue Duck Fries, the S.F.Y.), and others are 3-4 stars (the Blue Duck Sandwich, the Portabella Burger) but still satisfying. (And my friends have really enjoyed the General Tso wings and the Duck House Salad.)

There are two reasons I'm giving it 5 stars instead of 4: (1) you can tell that the staff is really excited about the food and loves what they do, so I have all faith that the quality of food and service will continue to improve (even though there's not much room for improvement!) and (2) There's still SO MUCH I want to try on this menu, including the entrees, tacos, and Sunday brunch!

Believe the hype... fresh, high-quality ingredients, with ever-changing specials - all done with incredible care and creativity! 
Among my favorites: 
-the General Tso's wings (I liked them so much they were my wings of choice for the Super Bowl this year... that's high praise!). 
-the Pork Roll Burger is insanely good!  
-All of their tacos are great - they switch these up very often, but they have one that with pulled pork that is as good as it gets..
General Tso wings are amazing!! Love that they have daily specials that are super creative.

One of my absolute favorite restaurants. Their dishes are one of a kind and their specials have my mouth watering! The staff is so friendly and nice. The atmosphere is perfect for a date night or a night out with friends. Highly recommend eating here!

The restaurant had a nice setup and atmosphere. The location has plenty of parking available which is always a plus. I came here as a party of 7 and we did have to wait quite a bit for our food to come out (about 40 minutes), but the food was good. I ordered the chicken and waffles which had great presentation, but the waffles were a tad less fluffy than I would've expected. Overall, still a good entree. The other people in my party also seemed to enjoy their food.
Food is outstanding!!! We had the duck fries, quack & Cheese and the BBBLT !!! Amazing! Tasty, casual environment and its BYOB!! It would be great if they were in centre city...it would be a hit!!!

I was blown away by the service and food here! Really creative spins on classic dishes with fresh ingredients... what more can you ask for? We had a reservation on a Friday night and they immediately sat us. We ordered the blue duck fries, brussel sprouts and brisket mac from the regular menu. We also ordered the calamari tacos (on special). Everything was ridiculously good and came out quickly and beautifully  (really nice presentation). They offered a nice selection of specials which I love in a restaurant, and our server didn't hesitate for a second when spitting them off to us! Already can't wait to go back :)

The duck fries are unbelievable. The citrusy wings were really good too. Dish I could certainly recommend is the chipotle caesar salad with shredded duck.  

Took a half minute for the starters to come out then little under a half hour after those in order for the food to come out. The pork roll burger was great, but small for it to be that price and not come with fries.

Very good food , but on expensive side.
Will definitely return! Had the turkey burger on one visit and veal sandwich special second time out both very good.

I came here because I heard awesome reviews about it and kept on seeing pictures of the food and especially the fries. So I was excited as I had arrived. The place inside had a more modern homie kind of feel. The waiter we had was a guy and it felt like he was new because whenever he came to our table, he made it awkward. He would just stand there and just not say anything for a few seconds to a minute. So we ordered the fries which was pretty good and probably the only thing worth it here. My friend ordered the b.b.b.l.t if I recalled correctly an the way they made it sound, it sounded like there would be plenty of bacon on his roll but it turns out it was only 2 strips of bacon on his roll. The hamburger/ roll was also tiny. Nothing really spectacular about it and for 9 dollars, I feel like it wasn't worth it at all. The next thing we ordered was the the beer battered wings. Those had absolutely no flavor at all. They were extremely dry and not worth it aswell. For my dish, I ordered the pork roll. I expected something spectacular because I kept hearing wonderful things about it. But to my surprise it wasn't anything special about it. I paid 10 dollars for a roll with pork and an egg on it and to my surprise it was even smaller then my friends burger. It was literally like a 4 inch potato roll. Definitely not worth it. All in all I feel like this place was "hyped" up. The only thing decent here at the time we went was the duck fries.

I was here for dinner with one other person.  Our server was very nice. The host was challenged. He attempted to sit a family of 4 at the table next to us. Mom, Dad, a toddler and an infant. Their table was against the wall and it was a two top. Kevin wedged the highchair between the two tables. I had to get up to move our table over so the highchair could sit on the floor properly. No Thank You from the host. Thankfully, the waiter told him to move the family to the more comfortable farm table. 

We split the duck fries. Not too greasy. I throughly enjoyed them and will go back to have them again.  
My dinner partner got the fish tacos. That was a mistake. They were to be salmon and scallop. There was a pinky nail of salmon on the taco. When I said something, we were brought out a piece of gently warmed salmon. It was cold in the middle. I mean cold. The waiter said that is how he likes it, it is med rare. There was no med about it. The scallop was slightly more done. 
I got the duck ragout, that was some seriously good eats. The only issue I had was the noodles. It claimed parpadelle, but those noodles were no more than 1/8 an inch wide and were al dente. You would expect the noodle to be at the very least an inch wide.

Now to dessert. We got the waffle fritters. They were not to my liking at all. They were a fritter filled with raw waffle dough.  The waiter said that is what the concept was. The outside of the fritter was really good. I couldn't wrap my head around the raw dough. I did send them a PM on facebook, he said he was sorry I didn't like them.  

I will go back to try the pork roll burger. I would love to see that ragout over fries or wide soft noodles. I don't think I would ever trust the chef with my dessert calories again. 

I really want this place to work out, as there is so much potential.

This is my third time here and finally giving a review since I've eaten each meal of the day. Tonight I had the Wild Mushroom Risotto starter and the Scallops as an entree. The risotto was rich and had a lot of different flavors for an all-around great taste. It worked as an appetizer because there was still room to eat something more. For my entree, they were all out of the side that came with it so I opted to take more risotto (no complaints here). The scallops were seared nicely and had a cream sauce to dip in for some extra flavor.

When I was here before, I had the Quack and Cheese which is a nice mix of pasta shells, craisins, duck meat, and some other stuff. I thought it was more of an appetizer, but it's definitely a meal in itself and a damn good one at that. I've also had the Pork Roll burger in which the pork roll is infused in the burger meat. It came with egg on it and this too was very good.

All in all, this place is great. The service is good and they are friendly. I'm looking forward to trying every item on the menu eventually.

I've added tonight dinner photos for your viewing pleasure.

Are you kidding? This place is fantastic. JUST KNOW, before you get here, it's byob. 
The food was ridiculous. I had the duck fries and "the Beast of the Northeast."  Both were incredible. Like, really, I eat out a lot, I fancy myself a jr. foodie... Anyway, food was incredible. Get yourself a bottle of wine, and get there. Idk why it only had 4 stars on here as of now.

My boyfriend's been raving about this place so I was really excited to try it! We came in for lunch on a Friday and were seated right away. We had an order of the quack and cheese and an order of the blue duck fries. The cheese on the fries were good - not grainy and didn't clump up as it sat or anything. But I was expecting more from both. Neither lived up to the hype but my boyfriend still swears by this place, so I'll be going back to try it again!

The combination of flavors that come out of this kitchen are insane! Do not let the strip mall location fool you...the chefs here work magic! First of all love low key atmosphere and that its byob. It amazes me when chefs think to put different tastes together and Blue Duck achieves this! We dined with a small group of teachers after work and the experience made all of our days! We started with the blue duck fries which were amaze! We ordered the General tso's tacos and got a second order as soon as we tasted them hahaha. The app that stood out to me was the fried cauliflower...seriously I could've eaten this the entire night! The blue ruck burger is very flavorful as well. We also ordered several things from the daily special menu...since it was taco Tuesday :) The shredded lamb tacos are on point! If they have the branzino special someone should definitely get it! My fav by far was the grilled octopus...there were so many different tastes in every bite. You won't want it to end I promise! I'm seriously impressed with this place! Well done and keep up the great cooking!

Hate to be a dick and low rate a popular spot BUTTTT my first and last experience just wasn't great. I only went here to begin with bc it was my gfs birthday and she got to pick the dinner spot.
We had a reservation since it was dinner for her birthday but when we arrived they didn't have a table reserved for our four top. So they placed us at the long picnic like table with another couple.. which was just weird. We had two seats between us and a couple eating lol. It was a Thursday night. Not a weekend, just to clear that up.
Anyways! Got cheese fries and blue moon wings for apps, wings were SO fatty, I picked it off bc the flavor was really great but still, that was gross. Fries were good!
We all ordered our entrees, I don't remember what my friends ordered but I opted for scallops. When the plate arrived there were THREE on the plate along with a teaspoon full of rice and a smudge of what I believe was couliflour puree. I literally paid l$21 for three scallops. 
They weren't huge, they weren't any different than the ones that are served at the seafood restaurant about a mile away from this place.
I do not live in NE and I wouldn't travel all the way there for this place. If you're in the area, check it out for yourself but don't go out of your way.
Sorry for the brutal honesty.

Great Classic Mac 
Great Blue Moon Citrus Wings 
Great Wild Boar Meatloaf but better seasoned mash potatoes and bigger asparagus would be nice for the price. 

I ordered out on a Tuesday night for the first time and I was empresses and will take out again and eat in too. It was a cozy environment and I like the byob

Blue Duck is a surprising find hidden in the vastness of Northeast Philadelphia.  It's def worth seeking out.  First of all the atmosphere is bright and cheerful with varied seating that ranges from a counter by the open kitchen to a large communal table near the entrance.  For my first visit I went with the blue duck sandwich.  (Who makes duck sandwiches besides this restaurant?)  It was great.  The shredded duck provides both a sweet and savory taste sensation. I could have used a bit more Swiss chard and a little extra of the blueberry bbq sauce but it was still totally tasty. The menu has much of interest to try on future visits now that I know how to get there.  Blue Duck is a worthy addition to the Philadelphia culinary scene!

Inside the restaurant, you would never guess this quaint place is located inside a strip mall. The wooden picnic-like tables, rustic silverware, and old school, hipster 1950's  soda cream shop vibe, really sets high expectations of a great meal. That, and the fact that this restaurant was completely packed on a Saturday night. While the ambiance definitely does not disappoint, the food is really a hit or miss. I thought the duck fries and my bf's blue duck sandwich were great. At the same time, how can you go wrong with the combination of cheese and fries? The blue duck sandwich, with shredded duck meet and roasted mushrooms was delicious -- savory with a hint of sweetness. For my own entree, however, I was not a fan of the Pappardelle (pasta with duck ragout, roasted portabella, dried cherries, shaved Pecorino). The actual taste of duck was lacking and my meal in general seemed to be lacking in flavor. I also sampled my friend's Wild Boar Meatloaf, and while the entree sounds rather  adventurous and enticing, it was more "meh" than "whoa." I would probably go here again but just go with the sandwich. I also hear their brunch is worth the trip. In the end, I give say this restaurant is "A-OK."
We used to go there for the Miso Sprouts but were super disappointed to hear that they have been replaced with some cheesy sprouts. The miso sprouts were one of a kind, bring them back!  .
My goodness. This place is almost too good to be true. Fantastic food, attentive service, and reasonable prices. What else can you ask for?

Stopped for lunch, food was really really good. burger was cooked perfect, medium rare - which is hard to get sometimes when ordering a fresh made burger. duck fries, gd taste and plenty of cheese ! on the other hand-staff was horrible, took 10 minutes to get the waiters attention and the place was not even half full. he finally took our order then didn't put it in until he took order tables orders which took another 5-7 minutes then he brought all there drinks and didn't bring ours. waiter never checked on us nor asked about drink refills ever. He took another 10 minutes to get the bill and pay.

We've been here for brunch and dinner and been very satisfied for both. One of our favorite dishes was the general tso's wings with blue cheese wasabi dipping sauce. Northeast Philly could definitely use more Center City type restaurants like this with more creative, interesting items then the run of the mill diners or dive bars.

We had a table reservation but decided to sit at the bar. Very cool to see how everything was made. Their duck fries are worth the trip to get there. I wish it was closer to center city but I'll live.

Fun and friendly staffed; they seem to have a great sense of humor and great attitudes. 

The food just speaks for itself- the General Tso wings are SO GOOD. 

The atmosphere is wonderful and inviting with an attentive staff.

Great little spot in NE Philly. BYOB!! If you go U Have to try the duck fries & quack and cheese. Blue Moon wings inspired wings are the real deal Holyfield as well. Staff was great, good atmosphere and very clean. Me & the wife both agree going to become a regular spot for us!!

Favorite spot in NE Philly. This place is a gem. From the outside it doesn't look like much but you won't be disappointed. The food is great and the duck fries and pork roll burger are fantastic! Clean atmosphere. Tough for larger groups since it's not a very big space.

Great for brunch! Relaxing/home-y ambience with great service. The host was very nice and friendly and we were able to be seated Day. Good variety in brunch food and very flavorful. Presentations was good as well

The food here is awesome!!! We came on a Saturday night and the place was packed!!! For such an unassuming location, it was wall to wall people. 
The decor is rather gaudy; it reminds me of my grandma's country kitchen but it was an intimate ambiance.
We ordered the blue moon and general tso wings, which were yummy! The general tso were sticky, sweet and a bit spicy, but the best part was the homemade wasabi Bleu cheese. Spot on!!! 
We also had the duck fat fries which were phenomenal!!! Salty, savory, cheesy, hand cut fries...everything just melted together for an amazing flavor experience!!! 
The original mac and cheese was ok; I'm not a fan of smoky cheeses in my mac and cheese, but it had a nice creamy consistency. 
I ordered a turkey burger for dinner which I was good. It was slightly dry, and it didn't come on a brioche bun as advertised but rather on a potato bun. I was a bit let down by that, but the burger was still good.
We ended the night with a lemon scented cheesecake. Incredibly delicious!!! The crust had a bit of saltiness to it which complimented the sweet cheesecake and bitter lemon. 
All in all, this place is delicious! Don't let their boring strip mall outside deter you from the yumminess inside!!!

This review is based on 2 visits- one where we were seated and one where we were not seated and decided to leave. 

I really wanted to like this place more. We took my friend from out of town for brunch. It was ok. The food was mostly good. My friend's roll was cold, like came out of the fridge cold, and it was an awkward sensation when biting into a hot burger and she was not a fan. My food was standard, nothing to rave about but nothing to complain about either. Husband liked the pancakes.  My complaint is the lack of veg friendly foods. The staff was friendly, and pretty quick. Our waitress was very nice when we questioned some of the things on our bill (2 extra entrees that we didn't order) and quickly fixed the check for us. Love the idea of the cute mason jars for coffee, but they were a little hot to the touch. We observed that there were a lot of little things that needed to be improved in the food and the service but we attributed this to being a new place and made allowances for growing pains.  Overall, it was a good enough experience to want to come back.   
Fast forward a month- we decided to give dinner a try in the middle of the week, at about 8 PM. Mistake One- no reservation. We show up and the place is full (and so so loud) and are told that it would be about 10 minutes, so we decided to wait.  We waited, and waited, and waited as many more couples came in, without reservations, and were seated. The way the hostess greeted these people made it appear as though they were friends, so maybe they got preferential treatment but still, after hearing the hostess ask if they had a reservation and finding out that they did not, they ended up seated. After 20 minutes, we decided to go. I told the hostess that we changed our minds and would be leaving and she responded with a sarcastic "Oh that's too bad." 

Really wanted to love this place, but the bad second date determined that this was not a match made in heaven for me.

My husband brought me here for dinner. This place is super cute. I love the open kitchen and the interior is very nice as well. Reservations are MUST since they don't have a lot of seating. They have few outdoor seating and this place is BYOB. Our server greeted us fairly quickly but took a while for her to take our order...due to the fact she had to read a long list of specials. Then had to do that for 3 other tables until finally coming back to taking our order. 

We ordered 2 sodas and who knew they're gonna give us 2 tiny bottles of coke and sprite. We got our food fairly quickly and the presentation was GREAT! I love their beet salad! Everything was great except the for duck fries. The fries just tasted like it was just drenched in grey and it didn't taste fresh. The fries were basically Cheese Fries with extra cheese.

I went in on a Wednesday it I was packed.  The burger was fantastic; the fries...well so so.  Most importantly it was clean and everyone took pride in their work.  Thank you Nick for treating us novices so well and treating my 10 yr old like he was a little man

Easily one of my favorite restaurants in Philly (#1 in the North East). A BYOB with a modern American menu. The Beast of the North East is a top notch burger. Their taco of the night is always great, and don't be a friend to try the duck fries. 

Their service is friendly and they honestly care if you enjoy your meal. If you're ever in the area, do yourself a favor and stop in.

Pretty good even tho I'm a lacktard. Everything here has cheese on it or uses heavy cream... but I loved it. Well worth it. Prices are great. Only thing I would want more duck on the fries. You must try this place.

6/20/2017 So I just moved my rating from 5 stars to 2.  We have been dying to get back to this place, we follow them on Instagram and told all our friends to try it. We went during the week at noon and there were only 3 other tables.  The waitress was amazing but the food mediocre at best.  The wings were not cooked quite enough but the sauce was still great. I got a brisket Mac and cheese which sounded like heaven. But not so much.  Very bland, no flavor at all, I had to ask for salt and pepper.  The kid didn't even like it.  Then my burger came.  I like it medium. I even like medium rare. It was raw and moldable the waitress took it off the bill it was so gross. The only thing that was good was the fries. Do disappointed. 

10/2/2015 So this place was up to all the hype. I'm just sorry I didn't try it sooner 
  First I suggest reservations and it is a BYOB. We actually got seated at the counter which I wasn't happy about but then I was super happy about it. It was awesome to see these guys in actions and get a look at all the amazing food that was being put out. We had the Mac and cheese with bacon. It was pretty good but not amazing. The buffalo wings were huge and delicious with a slight tang on the wings that made them awesome and we can't wait to get them again. We also had the fries fries in duck fat with duck crumbles on them. The fries where awesome. I didn't like the actual duck but the man loved it. The fries where somehow crispy and covered in cheese ( Miracle). Now we both had burgers which we had to change to to go because of children that needed picked up and thy wrapped our burgers up and we took them home and ate them. They were delightful he had the porkroll with a egg on top. And I had one with blue cheese. Can't wait to go back and try more things!!!

5-Stars for a great experience! 
We went on Saturday night for dinner and it was kind of crowded; we were seated at the bar which was pretty neat and we got to watch them prepping our food. 
The food was seriously prepared to perfection.
We'll be back!

The Blue Duck sounds like the prefect local spot for brunch, in Northeast Philly right? The food is decent, don't get me wrong. The signature duck fries are a delight, but that's where the praise ends... Our waitress did not bother to check whether we needed anything; she did not refill our water, while the men dining next to us had a full carafe. The place was packed, which is a no-brainer for a holiday weekend, but wait staff kept messing up orders all around us! (Hearing the head chef ranting in the back was hilarious.). So, we finished our fries and see that our food ended up at someone else's table. Before long, the waitress who served it (not ours) is throwing the dish away. Wow... Just wow. I had no choice but to inform the boss, who didn't even flinch, much less apologize. At least he had the decency to comp our meal. The duck fries are normally $14; while they are delicious, today's portion was overly salty and dry, hence not worth $14. Sorry, guys, no tip for you! Anyone looking for a great duck-centered meal in Philly, Sang Kee is the place to check out.

What can I add that everyone else already hasn't already hit on? I love that this amazing option is in a hood with no swank factor. The food is on point. The service is stellar. The smell inside will make your mouth water. Add BYOB? Perfect. Open kitchen so you can see what's doin. Stylish crew. Crowded with happy foodies. Way to go. It is taking a big risk to open in a hood that people are starting to give up on. Blue Duck has restored some glory to the N E
Blue Duck Fries, Quack and Cheese, General Tso wings, Duck Benedict and their spring rolls are so very good. I need to get dinner here but weekday lunch and weekend brunch is very good.

Went Back to the Blue Duck today as I wanted to give it another shot.  I have to say that this time around it was a much better experience and the food was wonderful.  I tried the Duck Fries again and this time they were perfection!  I also had General Tso's wings and they two were outstanding. Obviously the last time I went it must have been a fluke.  There is plenty of other things I want to try so I will be back.

The "gem" of the Northeast. Center City/South Philly restaurant in the Northeast. Not a fan of the location, but that doesn't define this place. Recommend to make reservations to get your spot. The menu is small, but it has so much flavor. The duck fries are a must and check out Sunday Brunch. Kris is an awesome person and chef. Glad that a place like this exists in the Northeast.

Staff was rude. Stared at my group the entire time. They were eating and licking their fingers...pretty gross. Gave us the wrong order, twice. This place is not worth the hype. Will not be returning. Only reason I gave two is because I like the glass bottles and the fries were good.

I was brought here for a birthday brunch by my wife and sons.  We had reservations and were seated with a nominal wait. Only the brunch menu was available. We ordered an order of the duck fries for the table, my sons both ordered the chicken and waffles, my wife ordered a prime rib special breakfast sandwich on a bagel and I got the duck eggs benedict. They were pretty busy.  We waited for a while to finally get the duck fries.  They tasted good but they were cold.  The gouda cheese sauce was hardened.  Disappointing.  When we finally got the rest of the order, I was disappointed to see that the eggs benedict was actually egg benedict. There was a small piece of bread, covered with a small overcooked, chewy piece of duck breast, with a single poached egg covered with sauce.   I will say that the cherry sriracha hollandaise sauce was terrific.  It really complemented  the dish well.  I just wished there was more food especially being the most expensive thing on the brunch menu. I thought this was a big ripoff for the price.  Luckily for me, my wife only ate half of her sandwich so I managed to stop my stomach from grumbling by scarfing the other half. The sandwich was not anything special.  I will not come back for the brunch, ever. I don't recommend it for others. However, the lunch menu does look pretty good.  I will not go out of my way to make a return trip but I would give this place a second chance if I'm ever in the area for lunch or dinner.  The BYOB is good to take advantage of.
This place is . Always a great time. Everything is delicious and the staff is great. Very accommodating. I wish it were larger.
Thought it was ok, not up to the hype I was hearing. My only dig would be the prices seemed a bit too high, especially for lunch and side orders. But the duck meat was cooked well.

We tried this place when they first opened and was a little disappointed. We live in the neighborhood and we really like to support our local business so we have returned for another visit. It nice to see this restaurant evolving. We made reservations upon arrival were sitting immediately. The Duck House salad again is amazing. The Blue Duck Fries so good, large portion smothered with smoked gouda cheese sauce and shedded duck were a meal in itself. My husband ordered the Pork Roll burger and I ordered a Vension Burger which was on the dinner menu both were excellent. The dinner menu has been expanded with more nice choices offered. The staff is pleasant and friendly, our waiter took the time to explain the evenings offing. Will definitely be returning.

Disappointment is understatement to say the least.
I give them year or two.
Granted seamed like everything was fresh made on site.

But sorry order were medium burger was well done.
My blt was a nightmare. Thin piece of tomato and one slice of lettuce w no mayo w a 1/2 lb of bacon.
Obviously chef doesn't try his food.

Because there is no way to eat this sandwich unless your a hog.

Ok the fries were good but cheeses was a cheap cheeses at the prices I excepted not to regret

Really this place would be 4 star if the revamp.
Dinner menu salmon n is 24 I can got to budaken at that price lol.

Ps sell your Bose  speakers and go get some enamel on that nasty floor.

Hostess lovely
This place was good but could be great
They were Out of 4 things on menu early Friday night
Onion soup awesome need to be warmer
Gnocchi gummy
Other pasta good
Will try again
Heard burgers Mac n cheese and fried chicken good
Went back
Mac n cheese good
Chicken overcooked
Pork roll burger good
Passyunk restaurants better
It's a BYOB, and the food is AMAZING. My money is on their "Beast of the Northeast," but you can't go wrong no matter what you order.

Ate here for the second time last night and again the food and service were both great.  Started off with the Duck Fries, Brussels Sprouts, and Chorizo Mac n Cheese, all three were great.  I could have eaten five plates of the fries.  

For our entrees my wife had the General Tsos Tacos, I had a Grass Fed Venison Tenderloin.  Venison, by nature, is very lean (especially when it's farm raised and grass fed) and they did a nice job of adding some richness to it with a heavily reduced berry sauce.

I love this place. Found a Saturday afternoon where it was kinda slow and had an awesome lunch. The turkey burger is ridiculous and you shouldn't leave here without getting an order of duck fries or quack and cheese.

Came here last night with a group of five. I know it gets busy so I made reservations which turned out being a good idea. It's BYOB so we all took advantage of that. For appetizers we ordered the Asian BBQ tacos (on special), and duck fries. Both great. For entrees we got the quack and Mac, caesar salad, duck sandwich, wild boar meatloaf, and the pork roll burger. Everything was delicious and we finished every bite! Device was awesome. Casual atmosphere. Great time with friends!

My girlfriend and I went for the first time last night. We had reservations for 7:15 but it was completely packed so we wound up having to wait for about 15 minutes. We took the first seats available, which happened to be seats at the counter. Sitting at the counter and being able to watch the chefs prepare our food as well as other's food really added to the experience! Every dish was excellently prepared and came out looking amazing. We ordered the Blue Duck fries to start, which were some of the best fries I have ever had. They had a creamy cheese sauce and shredded duck on top them. Then for our entrees, my girlfriend ordered a special for the night which was calamari tacos. They looked really good even though I don't like calamari. She said they were really good. I ordered the wild boar meatloaf. It was wrapped in bacon and served with red bliss mashed potatoes, grilled white asparagus, and brown herb gravy. It was absolutely delicious and the best meatloaf I have ever had! 

Overall it was a fantastic meal and I highly recommend it!
Not impressed! Over priced EVERYTHING! The chicken tacos were bland and just not good! The Mac and cheese was basic and soup was mediocre at best. Had such high hopes for this place!
I like their lobster Mac and cheese. Not sure why they think they are a five star restaurant in a strip mall.  Way expensive for what it is.  Specials are usually good.

Came here for dinner tonight with some friends. The service was great, love that it was BYOB, and the ambiance was very relaxed. The food was good, not great but good. The hummus and duck fries werw good although I thought the fries could have used more sauce. The mac and cheese was bland. Everyone enjoyed there entree. I had the fish and chips, the fish was good but lacking in some seasoning.  The portions were good. 
I heard that they had a good brunch so I will give it another try.

So this place was up to all the hype. I'm just sorry I didn't try it sooner 
  First I suggest reservations and it is a BYOB. We actually got seated at the counter which I wasn't happy about but then I was super happy about it. It was awesome to see these guys in actions and get a look at all the amazing food that was being put out. We had the Mac and cheese with bacon. It was pretty good but not amazing. The buffalo wings were huge and delicious with a slight tang on the wings that made them awesome and we can't wait to get them again. We also had the fries fries in duck fat with duck crumbles on them. The fries where awesome. I didn't like the actual duck but the man loved it. The fries where somehow crispy and covered in cheese ( Miracle). Now we both had burgers which we had to change to to go because of children that needed picked up and thy wrapped our burgers up and we took them home and ate them. They were delightful he had the porkroll with a egg on top. And I had one with blue cheese. Can't wait to go back and try more things!!!

Made reservations for my son's 18th birthday after reading about them winning the Philly Burger brawl.
Super friendly staff, homey, cool, comfy, never know you're in a strip mall decor. Open kitchen counter seating, which would be perfect for a date night.
Tons of staff, and very attentive.
Highlights of the meal were the quack and cheese and the duck fries. We all agreed we could have eaten the fries all day. In my opinion, a ketchup would take them over the top. Something sweet tart to cut the cheese and duck and fries, maybe cherry siracha?
Dinner highlights were the salmon special, boar meatloaf, and the fried chicken. Fried chicken and creamed swiss chard were fantastic.
Reason for 3 stars: worst part of the meal was the burger. Yep. The reason we came here. It was dry and bland and came with no sides. My son was really disappointed.
Dessert. Two options. Two. Chocolate mousse pie was just eh. Such a homey place should have a homemade cake, maybe pudding, and a fruit crisp on the menu. Lastly, super cute, SUPER FILTHY restroom. This is a bad sign for a restaurant. As Anthony Bourdain says in is best seller kitchen Confidential, any good restaurant will have a clean bathroom. If they don't keep what people see clean, what does the back look like??? Scary.
With the over abundance of staff running around for for about 13 tables, no one can wipe down the bathroom once an hour? Ive run 2 businesses, and I always cleaned the bathrooms. Get on it Blue Duck.
Would return if they clean it up and add some desserts and cook a better burger.

We loved our meal here! Everyone from the neighborhood raved about it and I can see why. 
My personal rating for what we ate:
Buffalo wings: 88%
Duck Fries: 90% 
The Duck special: 95%
The Beast: 93% - a little dry  
Excellent service and loved the decor. A gem in the northeast.

Blue Duck Sandwich is a nice restaurant in Northeast Philadelphia. The duck fries and pork roll burger were delicious. It's a BYOB place. The staffs are friendly. The restaurant isn't that big so you may want to make a reservations during peak hours. Parking is ample.

I went to the Blue duck restaurant on Fourth Of July weekend with my fiancee. 
We arrived thinking we'd be able to true the burgers and what not but sadly it was a Sunday so they were only serving from their brunch menu... But since this was a mistake on our part we decided we'd enjoy our meal anyway! 
We had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated, which was actually a good thing considering it was a holiday weekend.
The food is aesthetically pleasing but once I put it in my mouth I nearly gagged. We had ordered 3 items, the duck fries, a breakfast tostada, and some omelette thing.... 

We started with the duck fries and were NOT bemused. I was actively taking photos of everything that day... I realized after eating almost ALL the fries I hadn't taken a picture yet! It was just THAT delicious. The aroma was delightful... Duck fries have a million stars in my book...

After devouring that, we were anticipating what the next dish had to offer. Our omelette arrived... First impression was that something smelled entirely rotten.  I shrugged and tried to convince myself it was nothing.... As I cut it open the smell became more potent.... I pit it in my mouth... Didn't pass my tongue. 
This dish that looked beyond professional and beautiful didn't make the cut.

When the tostada were in view, my fiancee and I were praying that it would cleanse our pallets from the 'egg dish that shan't be spoken of'
Though it may have been delicious to most, brisket was the main ingredient used in this dish. I have very distinct standards concerning brisket.... In this dish the brisket was very fatty and slimy, not to mention it tasted undercooked. I couldn't eat much.... But my fiancee could tolerate it for a little longer. Over all the brisket tostada was a let down.

Reading this, you probably wonder why I gave this 3 stars. Well as we were preparing to pay the owner stopped us to ask how we enjoyed our meal. I said it was okay, trying not to be rude, but my fiancee (whom has no filter) expressed our true disgust over the last two dishes. At first I was embarrassed by my fiancee's loud mouthedness, and was starting to apologize when the owner instead apologized and removed the last two dishes from our bill. I've never experienced this before. So 3 stars for them!

Delicious food in the northeast, a rarity. The duck fat fries are amazing, a little on the heavier but absolutely amazing. The general tso's wings were also great. Unique entrees such as wild boar meatloaf also stands out. Add all those with a specials menu that changes daily and excellent prices - a must go. Center city quality away from all the hustle and bustle.

Came with friends to celebrate a birthday, and the burgers were great! Also had some blue duck fries that were a bit salty, but it tasted delicious! However, the wait was kind of long although there wasn't many people there. But overall, was a great experience, and the servers were nice and the food was too.

Never been here until today. Got the buffalo wings. Let the sit for a bit while drinking beer, watching football and doing laundry. Heated them up in the oven. F- delish. The blue cheese amazing.  Support mom and pops joints. Small businesses. It's what makes America beautiful. F chain restaurants. Thank you for the delicious food

Love the chicken salad and duck Fries...service is fast and friendly too...I also have had the pork roll burger which was great too...definitely one of the best places in the northeast to eat lunch or dinner

Burgers and fries are great
Brunch hit or miss
Pancakes cold
Chicken and waffles great
Breakfast special great
The reason for 3 stars is noise level
You couldn't hear anyone at your table
You were screaming to be heard

This place is amazing.  Great food,  great service,  price matches the quality of food.  It's a little too dark for my liking,  but would definitely come back.  Finally,  a spot in the northeast worth going to.

I was treated to a going away dinner here by my coworkers as I recently accepted a new job. I really enjoyed the place. As other reviews mention, The Blue Duck Fries are amazing and delicious. I've only had duck once before in my life and enjoyed the shredded duck confit on the fries. The smoked Gouda on top just sealed the deal. I ordered the Brisket Mac as my entree. I'm a fan of Mac and Cheese in general and it's a hard dish to mess up. The Brisket Mac was good, creamy and tasty. The added Brisket and jalapeños didn't do much for me, though. The next time I go, the Quack and Mac will be my first choice. 

The open kitchen was a nice touch and I found the layout and decor to be cozy, but not stifling or kitschy. We did go on a week day evening so I can't attest to how crowded it gets on weekends. Our waitstaff was attentive and nicely accommodated one of my coworker's request to change the bowl his meal came in as he was unable to use the original bowl because of his handicap. 

Overall, we had an enjoyable evening. I recommend you check this place out!

Had Sunday brunch with my husband. The waffles and chicken were very good. The waffles were light and delicious with the chicken fried to perfection. The brioche french toast was excellent. The home made whip cream was amazing. We brought in champagne and orange juice was provided for mimosas. The entire staff was friendly and very professional. Will definitely be making return visits.   I suggest making reservations.

Im definitely willing to give this place another shot...but my experience here was not as great as the majority of reviews here.

Blue duck fries and general tsos tacos were very good.  Liked the open kitchen and atmosphere.  But our entrees...were...not good at all!!!  In fact pretty damn bad.  

 My friend's seared ahi tuna was dried out and resembled canned tuna.  I mean it was white and dry and flakey!   Not a hint of pink in the whole thing.   We were comped for that portion of the bill.  I didnt complain as much because I honestly felt bad and was so disappointed.   My medium rare filet mignon was borderline raw/rare.   i had a hard time eating it but felt stupid complaining about both our meals so I ate some and left a lot on plate.    When I got home I ate a bag of potato chips.    Maybe it was just an off night.

Holy amazing. 

My boyfriend and I have been counting down the days until we could make a trip into the city for dinner here. Well we finally made it. We went early on a Friday night. And luckily were seated right away. (If you go after 6 on a weekend make a reservation).

We started with the chorizo  Mac and quack and cheese. Both were out of this world amazing. If we had to pick though we would have both picked chorizo to have again. We also got the duck fries. MAKE SURE YOU GET THESE. Yes caps were necessary. So freaking good. Kudos to blue duck for best fried I've ever had. We also both wanted the pork tacos on special and we're terrible sharers so we each got our own. They were great. Even better the next day. 

We will definitely be back again soon.

Went back last night 10/25. Just as good as it was before!! Love love love this place. Hats off to the chefs who made the night very entertaining!
Bland food. Poor service. Forgot about our food because the server moved our seats. Waited 1 hour for food because she forgot about it. Had the nerve to laugh about it and didn't say sorry about it.

Well-meaning but amateurish service. Ambitious menu but mediocre execution. A gastropub, but without a liquor license. I guess by Northeast Philly standards it's impressive but it wouldn't last a week downtown. Deafeningly loud when crowded - 80-90 decibels. You're better off at the Dining Car.

This restaurant is nice cozy and very bright on the inside. The food is delicious. My favorite is the quack and cheese. I also love the duck fries. I have been here several times, typically on a Saturday afternoon with friends. Another good thing about it is that it is a BYOB. The service is great.
Great place, great food please make a reservation it's a small place and always packed. I love the quack and cheese. Love it.
Nice decor, creative entrees, and awesome service await. Check them out for brunch on the weekend!

I'm not a person to write yelp reviews but the food and service was so great that I decided that this place could be my first. I sat at the bar with my boyfriend (up close to all the action). First of all, get the duck fries. Really good. I also had the fried chicken while my boyfriend got the shrimp tacos (those are part of their daily specials so might not be readily available). The Mac and cheese that came with the fried chicken was so good and perfectly cooked that I forgot I even had fried chicken on my plate. I also had a bite of my boyfriend's shrimp tacos and they were really flavorful. During this whole feast, the waitresses were super attentive. (I judge a waiter/waitress on how good they are if they refill my water without asking. They all passed with flying colors.) the chef even gave us a strawberry cheesecake on the house. If I wasn't sitting in front of them, I swear I would've licked that plate clean. I'll be dreaming of it tonight while crying myself softly to bed. All in all, exceeded all expectations and I'll definitely be coming back.

I went with friends for lunch.  We were a party of 9.  We arrived at 12:30 and there was only one party already seated. After we were seated,  we placed our order. The restaurant filed up quickly and all the other tables were served,  received their food and we continued to wait for our food. 

We waited for over an hour before our burgers, fries and wings came out.  The waitress dropped one person's order on the table and it was not replaced. Another had to wait for a glass of water for the hour between being seated and getting food.

We asked for the manager and he did not come.  The waitress said the train we didn't get our food was because the kitchen serves smaller parties first.  That being so,  all the tables who came after us were served and leaving before we received any food. 

The food was good but would have been better if we received our food at the sams time and it was, at least, warm.  The manager finally came over but had no explanation other than a miscommunication between the kitchen staff. Never again.

This place it's awesome. Delicious meal, good service I can't wait to eat here again and try some more of their dishes. We started with duck fries...yum, I had scallops they were cooked perfectly and like others have said the sides were also excellent.
My favorite place in North East Philly to get brunch, they have such a unique menu. Always something fun to try.

We had an amazing dinner at Blue Duck.   MAKE RESERVATIONS!!!  We had reservations but still had to wait about 20 minutes.  This is a small place and extremely busy.  We knew to expect this so this was not a problem.
