As we were eating, a lady who was a regular told us to make sure to try the specials and to get the fries with extra sauce.  Thank goodness we took her advise... All were fabulous.   I wish they had a sampler platter of everything on the menu because all sounded scrumptious.  The service was excellent.  The waitress was great.  As busy as this place was, we never felt rushed.  Thank you for a great time!!

Interesting concept. Fries were good, burger and duck sandwich were as well. Wings were nothing exciting. Service was good. Food took a while considering there were 4 cooks and we were the only table.
This place has great food and great atmosphere. My favorite part is that it's a byob. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because it's too loud. Lively atmosphere.

Getting together with out of town friend and family. Made reservations for 5 for 1:30 on a Sunday. Confirmed reservation via text Sunday morning. Got there a few minutes before 1:30, and the line was out the door. Checked in with one of the girls.waited 45 minutes, and never got seated. Kept waiting for a table to open up before we decided to go elsewhere. What's the point of making a reservation if it's not reserving anything? Saw that something similar happened to someone about a month ago. They wrote their party was comped with a $100 gift card. We got nothing. My advice, if you have more than 4 people in your party, go at your own risk, and have a backup plan.

It's so unfortunate that I rate this restaurant a 2. We have been here on 3 separate occasions and each time we have the same concerns. The food is hands down incredible. Everything is spot on, the duck fries are a MUST. The burgers are all delicious, the quack and cheese is out of this world. 
However it is really unfortunate that the service just plain sucks. From the first moment you enter through the door, no one welcomes you, not even a smile. I honestly believe that they are told not to smile. They all look miserable!  At our latest dine in, we made reservations and when we got there, we were being sat at the long farm house table in the front. Which for 4 people, is a bit awkward when there's a separate party sitting at the other end. We asked to move and thankful there was another 4 person table open that we grabbed. We were then given waters by another girl and guess what not only did she not say hello, or smile, she barely opened her mouth to say you're welcome after we thanked her for the waters she gave us. It looked painful for her to speak. Then our waitress came over, I was really hoping for more but unfortunately got more of the same. I guess they all just drink from the same kool-aide!  There was no "hi welcome to blue duck my name is ..." NOTHING! If it weren't for her name plate necklace we would had no clue who this girl was. She was decent, but still not very attentive. We brought beers and wine and often times didn't clean the empty bottles on the table, we literally had to ask her to take them.. Take any of our dirty plates. 
Apps were all delicious, we had the cauliflower, the duck fries, and two different wings. All apps came out about the same time and we're all steaming hot and delicious. 
Then we waited awhile for our entires. We had ordered a burger, fried chicken, scallops, and gnocchi. The burger came out first and then sat there for awhile.. We finally had to tell our friend to eat without us because the rest of our food was taking so long. When we looked back at the cooks, they were all flirting with the girls at the counter. Really?? We could see that even our waitress was annoyed. The rest of the food came out, but again not all at the same time. Other than the timing of the food, the food was delicious. 

It's just a shame. The food is slamming. All around, never had anything here my friends or myself didn't love. (I think my suggestion is take-out.). HOWEVER!! Everything else is blah! And honestly the servers at chick-fil-a are more polite and friendly. Take a page from their book!  We are total foodies, love great food, and kill for awesome service. If the owner or chef is banging out such great dishes, they need to look at the front of their house and get that up to speed! They are killing their business with mediocre service.

I have been following and waiting for this place to open. Finally was able to get a reservation on Thursday. My husband and I decided to do the dinner menu with some appetizers The Duck House salad was amazing, fresh and bright, could have ate the whole plate instead of sharing. Next we order the General Tso wings, not so good. Pink bordering on red. When I mention this to the waitress her answer was they were big wings and really fresh and they should look like that. I don't think so!!!!! Next my husband ordered the Wild Boar Meatloaf, taste was good. a little dry and the bacon could have been crisper. I ordered the scallops, a little under-cooked for my taste but had good flavor. We will go again and try their sandwiches.
The duck fries were wonderful! Also had the wings! Delish!! I'll definitely return again!!

Well, for here in the N.E. ...finally an awesome spot for dining pleasure! After much ado...I finally got to check out this quaint little spot in the neighborhood. Well its def. worth a stop. I went in, doubtful that I'd like duck ..but gave it a shot. It was great, had the omelet with duck in it and it was delicious, had the salt & pepper fries, fabulous, and the french toast was devine! The iced tea was very good, had some flavors that were different for me, but it was excellent nonetheless. This time it was for brunch, next time I stop will try the dinner....let ya know about that!  Til next time , Good job, keep up the good work, need more foodie places like this in N.E.!!!

I've been going to Blue Duck since they opened and have always enjoyed my meals, the service and the restaurant. What made me write this review was how they recently helped out a friend. After having a rough week she went to Blue Duck for her belated birthday dinner. I emailed ahead of time to ask if I could leave flowers at her table and it was of course no problem. I went ahead before she got there and dropped off a card, flowers and a bottle of champagne. They were more than accommodating and made her feel extra special when she got there. Thank you, Blue Duck for treating your customers like friends and not just a paycheck.

Four stars because the place is so incredibly small and crowded it's hard not to yell to speak with your party. Went on a Saturday night. Called for reservations early in the day (right after 11am) and there was only a reservation available for 8:30pm for two. We were seated right on time upon arrival. We ordered the duck fries which were good- the fries seemed homemade and very crispy which I liked. The Gouda is a good choice for cheese too but the duck wasn't as flavorful as I would've expected. Next we ordered the tacos- this day was beef brisket. They were absolutely delicious! $23 for three tacos seems excessive but they were good enough that I can overlook the price this time. They were listed as MP which I think is a little silly unless they're serving lobster at some point. My husband got the Philly burger. It had bacon on it and was cooked perfectly but it was just "good", not as great as reviews made it out to be. The choklate cake dessert was a waste of calories and money, it was bland without the flavoring (mint and raspberry) but the flavoring was too strong with mint. Service was excellent. I will return just because there was so much I want to try, including mac and cheese and French toast. I will update when I return.

I will start with the duck fries. THEY ARE AWESOME! The chorizo mac n cheese was good but once I tried the fries it seemed nothing else compares. We had bass and fried chicken both were good but the sides stood out for both of us. The stuffing with the chicken was delicious, the risotto with the fish was yummy and smooth. But all in all the food was good. If you want to check this place out the one thing I would suggest you must try are the fries....They are like grown up cheese fries sprinkled with happiness and a little bit of scallions!

Great food, nice atmosphere. The menu is one the smaller side but everything I've tried has been pretty good to great! This place is a hidden gem in northeast Philly but feels like a no libs style restaurant

As good as it gets in Northeast Philadelphia really. Delicious food. Standard pricing. Loved having the desserts and where they came from explained to us. Our waiter was adorable and very attentive. Perfect date night.

There is plenty of parking spaces. It was my first time here. I dine here for two and we have to share a table with other family. However, it was a long table which we sat at the end so we still have some privacy and still feel comfortable. The decoration inside is relaxing. Servers were very helpful and nice. We have beast of Philly burger, duck fries, and another entree I couldn't recall. Point here is, the food were good. I really recommend the duck fries.
The food is delicious, I wish the place was bigger, the tables are too close, but we really enjoyed our meal. I can't wait to go back and get more of the fries.

The blue duck fries (in the middle with the cheese on top) are a must. I know a lot of reviews say to get it, which might make people skeptical. But believe me and whatever they say about the fries. Blue duck fries can be a meal itself if you have a small appetite. There are some fries with more salt than others but its a seasoning no big deal. 
Now if you're like me and need a little more, sure order either the quack n cheese OR burger (I got smoked bbq pork). Ordering both is way too much. I thought I could handle it. 
Quack n cheese (green bowl) has portobello mushroom, scallion, dried cherries. 
Smoke bbq pork is served on potato bread. The salt from the fries goes well with the pickles. 
Happy with my choices. Left bloated.

It's always nice to see a restaurant open in NE Philly that doesn't serve Pizza or Chinese food.  It's especially nice when the place puts some real effort into decor, staff, and service along with a nice menu and some solid specials.  The Blue Duck is exactly the kind of restaurant we need, and hopefully they will thrive so that other restaurateurs will see that our area of town can be a profit center as well as a destination to dine.

As always, I over-ordered.  I tend to do this on the first time out, but the bright side is plenty of leftovers and a nice sample of the menu.

Started with a special, shepherds pie fritters.  Nice bits of lamb, peas, potato and  seasoning rolled in a very large ball, breaded and deep fried.  It was delicious.  I also sampled the grilled romaine salad.  I've had similar salads, and this one was a bit of a mess on the plate, but it tasted fine.  I don't know if I would rush to it again,

Dinner was the Blue Ruck Burger and a side of the Blue Duck Fries.  The burger was a bit overdone for my taste, but it had nice flavor and consistency.  It's an odd patty blend of duck and beef, and I don't know that the addition of duck really brought too much to the game.  The crispy bits of duck cracklins that topped the burger was a nice touch.  I've not had that on a burger before and it stood out without detracting from the burger itself.  They would have been nice on the salad as well. Actually, they would be good in a bowl on the table...or at my house in front of the tv.  Good anywhere...really.  Duck cracklins could be the new pork rinds, but better.

I was thrilled with the  Duck Fries, smothered in melted Gouda cheese, scallions, and a healthy dose of Duck confit, which I can never get enough of.  Duck on fries is magic.  I'm pretty sure that regardless of my entree, I will be ordering a bowl of these for the table.  If you get nothing else, order a bowl of these to munch on.  You won't be sorry.

The service was very good.  We came on a Tuesday evening around 6:30 and had no trouble getting a table, but by 7:30 the restaurant had filled up.  A full house on a Tuesday night is a good sign.  My only fear is that if it's the only game in town, it will quickly become a hassle to try and dine there.

Get the word out!  Come eat here!  Just don't come when I want to eat.

In Philly for a family visit to see my son. He took us here, a first  for  us all. Well were we pleasantly surprised. A nice bright and clean venue. Cheerfully greeted at the door and promptly seated. The menu is well planned and has a little for everyone. My wife got the duck/beef burger which was prepared to her satisfaction and served with a pickle. She also got the salt & pepper fries which were served with a cheese sauce and we're enough for the three of us. My son got the bison burger which came medium as ordered. I ordered the fried chicken, delicious. Our waitress,  Nicole was very attentive.  If I get the chance before leaving for home I will definitely make  a return visit. Highly recommended. Good luck to the BLUE  DUCK from a FJ '67 alum.

I hear great things about this place and I thought it would be great to come eat here instead of some place in center city where it's hard to find good parking. I really liked the duck fries and duck mac and cheese. Although not a huge fan of the dried berries on the mac dish, not exactly my type of thing. I also had the ice cream dessert, dunkaroonies, which felt like a child-like ice cream with tones of jimmies. I like how hip and lax the restaurant is, it's nice and casual. I do wish it wasn't so loud in there, but I think it's like that because the restaurant itself is small and echos or amplifies the people talking. One thing I felt about the service: I liked that our waiters were very kind and made sure we got what we needed, but I felt like they were also a little less attentive than they should be. The food is still great. Just not too crazy about the way it is there

Just had a great lunch here. Only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is the wait time for the food at not such a busy time of the day, but that might actually be our fault I should have asked the server to fire everything at once instead of firing the fries as an app. Anyway, great food, space is decorated nicely, was loving the play list too. I'm really happy to finally have a place like this in my neighborhood and I wish the chef and crew the best of luck, hope they're very successful.

I was there for the first time. I loved it I had the portabella mushroom sandwich. And the duck fries were amazing !! I took my 2yr old there also I didn't see a kids menu but when the server came over she told us they offer grilled cheese and chicken fingers. I was very happy about that I didn't even have to ask her. The one thing that I didn't like was how loud the music was.

What the Duck! -SOOOOOO DIssapointed
Went there on Sunday-12:30 reservations.  One person ordered decaf-was told they were out of coffee! (they did find some later).  No lemons for the tea.  Screw up on order-we wanted 3 quesadillas.  Two came and were so stingy with the contents of the wrap that we were all stunned.  Third one finally served (by that time, the rest of us were done our meals). My friend spoke to the waiter and said "you are not going to charge us for that last, late meal, are you?"  They didn't BUT they should have spoken up first.  What if she hadn't said something?
The website should let you know that when brunch is served, you cannot order anything other than the brunch items. (one of the 5 of us wanted to try a regular sandwich).  Waffle was okay, fried chicken with it much better.  Duck L'Orange tasty but skimpy
Was expecting so much more after the great reviews. Were we at the wrong place?
Shelly R

This place is excellent, I just wish they had more seating. The quack and cheese is amazing and the pork roll burger will make you want to slap your own mother. Hands down the best place in the northeast to grab some grub.
Staff was awesome nice courteous and friendly! Food was a little pricey but very very good! Excellent place!

Ate there twice with really good experience. Third time, not so good, not sure if it was a bad day or they just got too cocky for their own good. We sat for over an hour before I asked the server why we still hadn't been served, it turns out they "Lost" our ticket and our order was non existent. We could have sat for 5 hours and no one would have noticed since our server NEVER interacted with us once she took our order over an hour ago (that she ended up losing anyway) 1 hour 45 minutes later we ate, with no apology or compensation or regard for the fact that we sat there for almost 2 hours like assholes. In the end our bill was delivered and AGAIN absolutely no regard for the fact that some screwed up royally. The menu is unique, the food is good, UNFORTUNATELY as a paying customer, it is up to YOU AND ONLY YOU to harass your server on a constant basis to ensure that you actually get to eat.

After posting this review on their Facebook page, the manager Nick lied, saying I paid my check at 12:08, actually that is when we gave our order a second time, he also said he compensated us by not charging us drinks. It's a BYOB, I brought my own champagne and orange juice. They were very shady about the whole situation. Obviously I'll never go there again.

Stay away!! Blue Duck is a Lame Duck! This restaurant doesn't live up to the online hype. It has a tacky decor, small portions for high prices, and everything needed salt. The Duck Fries were ok; I'll give them that. However the wife and I had 3 of their entree's and two of them were terrible.Their Wild Boar Meatloaf tasted like spam.The duck in their pasta had a slimy texture, tasted like mackerel (?!), and had a bitter undertaste.The chicken was ok; nothing spectacular.Within an hour of leaving I had a stomach ache and diarrhea. I'll never return.

A fantastic restaurant nearby that saves us a drive into Center City Philadelphia - sounds too good to be true but that's what the reviews promised - and they delivered. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The room itself is on the plain-side with next to no decorations on the walls.  It was also, like many Philly restaurants, fairly loud.  

But on to what was more important - the food !

The "Quack & Cheese" was most likely the best mac & cheese we've ever tasted.  It was made up of delicious shredded duck, roasted portabella mushrooms, smoked Gouda and dried cherries and was way large enough for the 2 of us to share.

The Fried Chicken with Sriracha buttermilk coating was very good without being spicy-hot from the sauce.  It came with Swiss chard & Pancetta.  The Duck Breast entrée with Brussels Sprouts and Boursin cheese was also delicious.

What we found somewhat amazing was the care given not only to the main ingredients in the dishes but also how well prepared the various vegetables were cooked and presented.

So with tax & tip the bill came to around $66.  This is way less than what you would be charged for a similar high quality meal in places downtown. (Remember - it's a BYO.)

Needless to say, we will be back!

Phenomenal finger foods.
They've got this seasoning on the fries, it must be sprinkled. 
I thought snack packs as a dessert item were a little odd and definitely lazy, but still delicious. 
If you don't choose blue duck then fuck you. 
Brunch was lovely. Came for the French toast. Stayed because I had 3 bloody Mary's and couldn't see the front door clearly enough. 
Not enough cowbell. 
My bison meatloaf was a perfectly cooked slice of loaf, wrapped in the city's crispiest bacon, atop creamy mashed potatoes, aside beautifully stir fried asparagus, for me to poop on!
I've never even seen a blue duck, but want to.

I have been to the Blue Duck a handful of times now and I like how they are bringing something different into the Northeast area. The idea behind using duck is pretty cool since most of the restaurants around here are chains or typical bar food. The place is warm and inviting, although I think they dim their lights down way too low when it's dinner time. Byob is awesome! I've had their duck house salad, chorizo mac and cheese, duck fries, wild boar meatloaf, and general tso tacos. Duck fries are on point! I waited till my 4th time going till I got the duck fries and I'm a little bummed I waited that long. The duck house salad is amazzzzzzzing. Meatloaf wrapped in bacon was delicious and their mashed potatoes are yummy. Downsides, they used a little more cheese than I would like in the mac and cheese and too much sauce on my taco.  Lastly, they need to work on perfecting their coffee before charging $3 a cup.  Cute place, friendly service. I'd eat there again.

What the duck did I just eat?  For some time, I had read excellent Yelp reviews and recommendations on this restaurant.  My girlfriend and I decided to check out The Blue Duck for a Sunday brunch.   

The appetizer course started with the Blue Duck Fries (sea salt seasoned fresh cut fries, covered in Gouda cheese, scallions and shredded fatty duck) and the General Tso Wings (large sized wings in very savory general TSO sauce).  The main course consisted of an omelet that was stuffed with fatty shredded duck, onions, peppers, potatoes and Gouda cheese.   We sat outside and enjoyed a few beers (BYOB) while taking in the cool breezy temperature.  The service was attentive and the food was delicious.  I can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

My third visit to this rave restaurant turned out badly.  ordered house salad and the fried chicken.  Chicken came out burnt and greasy,  salad was over dressed and limp. Found myself in the bathroom tossing up the meal two hours later, awful awful.
Very friendly and helpful staff. Food is great. One of the best spots in the NorthEast.

I highly recommend this restaurant! This restaurant is in a shopping strip and I personally think its a great location. The restaurant itself is small. I also do not think they can have more than one big party at a time. There was a big table that I saw when we first walked in that fit about 8 people. The seating it limited which is probably the downfall of this restaurant, I hope that it will expand because the employees are great and the food is even better. We were seated in minutes which I was surprised since it was a Friday night. Blue Duck is also BYOB!! So bring that beer or wine! 

We ordered: 

Blue Duck Fries ($13)- hand cut fries tossed in duck fat. Smoked Gouda Cheese sauce, shredded duck confit topped with scallions-- WOW!! I will come back just for the fries! I LOVE FRIES AND THIS IS PROBABLY NOW MY FAVORITE

Wild Boar Meatloaf ($19)- whipped in bacon, red bliss potato mash, baby heirloom carrots and herb brown gravy-- I wanted to try something different and of course this did not disappoint! There were 3 big slices of meatloaf covered in gravy and my favorite part was the bottom where the mash potato was! I LOVED THE MASH! They should def offer this as a side because I would get loads of this for myself lol  

Fried Chicken ($19)- pickled- brined, cream Swiss chard & bacon, mac and cheese with tabasco honey-- my hubby order this and he loved it there was nothing left on his plate which is strange because he usually takes some home. He said he really enjoyed his meal and he also really liked the mac and cheese. 

BLUE DUCK! thank you for existing and I will be back more friends and family! Can't wait to see what other specials they have to offer.

Blue duck is a simple take on BYO's in NYC or downtown Philly. The food is good for the area but it's a one trick pony and the pony isn't quite the stallion it should be. I will say it doesn't change enough and there aren't enough specials to keep the seasoned blue duckers satisfied. It's definitely a pick a menu favorite and come and scratch the itch once a month or less. I was there three times and only for dinner and I was already bored. I am very curious as to what their brunch is like. I have heard good things and it's hard to screwup eggs (although it can be done). Even the brunch menu hasn't gotten any type of makeover since it opened (I think). Anyway, the first time I was there I had the Brussel sprouts with bacon, fried cauliflower, and the duck special. Fried cauliflower was really delicious and cooked perfectly. The Brussel sprouts were very good as well. I just wondered where their veggies are sourced. They were very big Brussel sprouts which makes me think they may have been from a wholesaler and not a local farmer. Either way good. The duck was ordered medium well and it came pretty much raw. The skin was crispy which was nice but I didn't want duck sushi. Sending it back isn't an option since the mental picture is there and the meal is basically over. Food should never have to be sent back to be cooked right. Step your game up chef. Granted they were busy but that is no excuse since top chefs like Mark Vetri consistently churn out perfect dishes one after the other daily. If you wanna be on that level, you gotta cook at that level. Earn your rep boys. The first go round was about a 5. The person I went to dinner with got salmon and it was a  very nice piece of fish and the potatoes were quite delicious. The second time I was there I had a better experience with where we sat but the food was really lackluster. I usually try specials when I am at a byo, but I decided to change it up and try an in-house staple, the fish tacos. Granted I do not like farm raised tilapia and neither should you but I gave it a go anyway. It's pretty gross when you see how they raise those things but nevertheless I went in with an open mind. A lot of times you aren't even getting tilapia, unbeknownst to the chef but that's a different story. Ok, so the fish tacos. The tortillas were kind of cold and really just raw. You can't just lay tortillas down under got food. They get soggy and the texture ends up feeling very mushy and soggy. The toppings weren't amazing and it could have used a little more umph (fresh veggies, cilantro, slaw etc). The mayo was haphazardly squeezed on top in very unappetizing squiggly lines. It made the dish look cheap and like something Denny's would have on their international dinner menu. The fish was deep fried like it should have been, but the taste was just bad. Fresh fish isn't fishy and has a very delicate flavor. Frozen, farmed fish taste like the slimy toilet they are bred along with subtle but familiar freezer after taste. I couldn't eat the fish tacos. I was skunked at the duck again.  I think blue duck should really run in the, locally sourced, FARM TO TABLE FRESH, healthy food
with constant new takes on the menu. Otherwise they won't be around long. Although the northeasters really don't expect much in way of cuisine ( that's why so many greasy spoon diners remain open there amongst the fast food and bad pizzas). The northeast is hellosh when it comes to trying to find healthy, delicious, interesting food. The blue duck could save the day if the mama duck can get the bull whip out and get to work kicking those little ducks asses into shape. The owner is a very nice guy and the whole staff is likable and sweet.  Also, the female waitstaff are all very nice to look at... Especially one in particular ;) B 
I like this place but I wanna love it. It's like a coach wanting a player to succeed in the highest level. You wanna see a culinary underdog like the BD make it because they are great for the area and I love that they are expanding people's horizons and opening their minds. The northeast is where I am from and I know how close minded people can be. It's tough to make it in the city but at least there are people who know good food when they see it. They can get good feedback and perfect their menus based on foo foo customer reviews Etc. The only way to get good, is to find out what you are doing bad and change it. I really want this place to make it past those dreaded first years and become a staple. They are the bar setters and I am hoping a total food revolution takes place in that area. I am rooting for the duck and I will continue to eat there.

Had a visit back to Philly in August and everyone at home recommended The Blue Duck. Friendly service and a really creative menu. I stopped in mid-afternoon for a sandwich and fries but they do simple food really well. Love the open kitchen vibe and the quaint decorations. Easily the best spot in the northeast and my new go-to when I'm home from the west coast. Kudos guys.

Everything I said to my prior review and more. I've been wanting to try Southern style chicken and waffles for a long time. I searched through and through. All of a sudden, a Yelper points out to me that The Duck offers them on Sundays. Oh, The Duck! I had been here before, and thoroughly enjoyed my food. Why not have at it again?

Brunch is 10-3 on Sundays (it's recently been changed). They offer a different menu with an interesting choice of specials (if I wasn't mistaken, I believe I saw what looked like Fruity Pebbles cooked into French Toast going to someone's table). I skipped the specials because I knew what I was there for. While I was at it, I went for the General Tso Wings for an appetizer, because...why the hell not? Wings sounded great at 10am. A cup of coffee also accompanied my meal. 

As I waited for my food, I did see that the place fills up QUICK. We even got there a few minutes before they opened, and there were people already waiting to get in. It's a small space. It's cozy. You will have a table 2 inches from yours, but it's fine. You'll be so focused on your food that it won't even matter. I suggest you make a reservation, which they gladly take, or just get there early. 

The Rivals Bros coffee was delicious. It's $3.00 a cup, but the cups are pretty big with welcomed refills. My wings had such a beautiful presentation that I didn't even want to touch them. They were FANTASTIC. It was $6.00 for 6 very large wings that were tender and bursting with flavor. I could have eaten that side of wasabi blue cheese with a spoon. It was smashing. I would have been fine with coffee and wings alone. Shortly after came out the chicken and waffles. I actually really loved that it wasn't drowning in syrup (though if you're a syrup lover, you will want more-- they use it sparingly). The waffle was good. The chicken....that chicken was so great. It had been a very long time since I had eaten a piece of fried chicken, and it was worth eating. How you're able to get the outside so deliciously crispy while retaining the moisture within is behind me, but I was certainly pleased. 

The guy that runs the place (I'm only assuming he runs the place) is really friendly. He treats everyone like he knows them, which is super dope. The waitress we had this morning was sweet (something that fell short the last time I had been here...but the food was so good the first time that I didn't give a shit how grumpy my server was). Today though, it was all good. Yes, the hostess isn't the happiest person in the world, but who cares? My bill came out to around $32 (I was with someone else who had also ordered a coffee, as well as the chicken and waffles). Left the waitress a really heavy tip and practically rolled out the joint. I was stuffed. 

I can't wait to to do it again.

I also vote that you leave the hip hop on, but that's just my opinion. =P 

Keep up the good work, guys. Please don't get so cool that you have to relocate downtown. I like having a place with truly awesome food so close to home.

Excellent, creative food with better than average portions for the price. I am so spoiled by the comfortable decadence; while this seems contradictory the management & staff are so welcoming that the atmosphere feels like eating a meal at your friend's house ... your gourmet chef friend. No one will make you feel dumb when reciting the specials. All the burgers are yum, the duck fries are silly richness, & i could eat those duck pierogies almost every day. The wings are great, mac & cheeses rich & flavorful, potato croquettes with crab so filling (could use some salt). We also went for the taco showdown & loved the idea of guest chefs & special menus - nothing wrong with changing it up. Both the restaurant & bathroom are clean. I love the open kitchen - no shenanigans here! I'm a huge fan of BYOB - champagne with everything! We eat here fairly frequently & are never disappointed. Keep the yummy coming!

Came to celebrate my play Bros bday. This place is tucked away in a shopping center in the Northeast. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. 

The food was served in huge portions. My bro had fried chicken that was served in huge pieces and I had the duck fat fries. The fries were great and the portion was humongous. The duck fat fries had an abundance of duck meat and cheese. If for nothing else but the duck fat fries, I would return if in the area. The menu was somewhat limited to me and the restaurant served bottled beverages.

Where do I begin... ambiance in a strip mall, The Blue Duck achieved that in spades, with its mismatched china plates gracing the walls, wainscoting, farmhouse wood tables and cement floor, then you notice the open concept kitchen, if you're alone or with a date opt to sit at the "bar" overlooking the grill and watch the magic happen.  The place is BYOB, so bring your own booze and let these local guys focus on the some of the best food combinations I've had the pleasure of eating.  I almost always get the the special because ... c'mon you cannot skip it! They do some kick ass fried chicken, fries you could easily overload on, burgers, giant BLTs made with bacon fat infused mayo, amazing chicken salad ... all these sandwiches served on brioche buns yummmmm.  Anyway that aside,  the full on entrees are bad ass.  You'll want to high five the chef when you leave...I know I used bass ass and kick ass twice, but that's why you need to be here ... now... because it's Sunday and their brunch will change your life. Cheers!

Four stars because the place is so incredibly small and crowded it's hard not to yell to speak with your party across even a small intimate table. We went on a Saturday night. Called for reservations early in the day (right after 11am) and there was only a reservation available for 8:30pm for two. We were seated right on time upon arrival. We ordered the duck fries which were good- the fries seemed homemade and very crispy which I liked. The Gouda is a good choice for cheese too, but the duck wasn't as flavorful as I would've expected. Next we ordered the tacos- this day was beef brisket. They were absolutely delicious! $23 for three tacos seems excessive but they were good enough that I can overlook the price this time. They were listed as MP which I think is a little silly unless they're serving lobster at some point. My husband got the Philly burger. It had bacon on it and was cooked perfectly but it was just "good", not as great as reviews made it out to be. The chocolate cake dessert was a waste of calories and money, it was bland without the flavoring (mint and raspberry) but the flavoring was too strong with mint. Service was excellent. I will return just because there was so much I want to try, including mac and cheese and Stocks pound cake French toast. I will update when I return. 

***Update- Today I called at 10:10am and asked for a reservation for 3 at 11:30am. They said they were busy but we could sit at the counter and reserve that space. One friend canceled and the other one was 15 minutes late because she drove past the place. They still kept our counter space for us and didn't complain which I appreciated. I had BIG intentions to have the Stock's Pound Cake French toast that was still currently on the downloadable version of their menu online, even though it wasn't listed at the restaurant or on the website itself. I expressed my disappointment and they gave me a complimentary Cuban egg roll which was absolutely amazing! The challah french toast with whip cream and maple syrup was delicious even if it wasn't as unique as I would've imagined the pound cake to be and the chicken and waffles were just the right amount of savory/sweet combo. They serve excellent coffee and service was friendly, funny and tolerated my pouting and sassiness with wit. I would say you definitely need to make reservations ahead of time during the busy shifts. The staff works together well and even though the place is small, can be hard to get into and loud at times (today we were part of the loud), I'll be back and highly recommend you try it out too!

Have been wanting to check this place out for a while as I work within walking distance but it took until yesterday to actually drag my ass there. The food is spectacular all around. Imaginative preparations and riffs on classics that from what I can see all work well. The place was very busy for Thursday lunch time and I hope they are this way every day as NE Philly needs a good destination restaurant. The place is small and loud but has great energy, great service and an almost diner/cafe feel. We need to get back soon for dinner. This place is awesome.

Obsessed!! Holy S&*%T it's good!! I came on Saturday during lunch and we sat outside since it was a nice day. It's a small spot so be sure to make reservations no matter what time of day you go. 

Yes you have to try the duck fries. They are bomb.com and you just need them in your life, trust me. I also had Cuban egg rolls and general tso wings. I honestly have nothing bad to say about this place. The food was amazing and the service was awesome. I'm totally coming back.

I returned for dinner & it was better than the brunch for sure but still didn't knock my socks off but it was enough of an improvement to earn another star from me. I love cheese but they seem to use it as a crutch in a lot of their dishes. The duck fries were swimming in melted cheese. The chorizo mac & cheese was equally drowned but that is expected. My problem is the cheese in that kind of quantities overwhelms the other flavors. The salad was good but nothing special and the house grind burger about the same still heavy handed with the cheese to the point where I could not identify that there was any garlic mayo on the thing. My husband's ruck burger was super dry more than the garnishes could make up for. Where this place really falls down is the service. Our waitress clearly just wanted the night to end and barely greeted us but she did come back a lot to try and take our order. We were not told about any other drink options besides the water that was given and had to ask for it to be refilled, we weren't told thank you when the check was brought or when we left. I mean I know these are little things but ya know it is the little things that make you feel welcome. On that note the manager was super great. He greeted us, sat us, gave us the menus & silverware, told us about the specials and was generally pleasant and clearly wanted our business. On the whole I guess I just want this place to be better than it currently is so I wish them the best and hope they stay & improve because we need more places willing to do new things in the area.

Had the duck fries and they definitely cause you to keep coming back for more. Really delicious texture and taste to fries and it's a yummy combination. Had the fried chicken which was cooked perfectly but you don't really taste the sriracha at all. I was expecting a little kick. Other then that the Mac and cheese and spinach was amazingly yum. My fiancé ordered the blue jawn and he enjoyed it. Service was good and it was a cute little spot. Definitely will be returning since it's so close to our new apartment.

The pork roll burger is awesome, cannot go wrong with that!  Also huge fan of the blue duck fries & chorizo mac and cheese.  I love all these things so much that it is hard to try new things when I go!
Great food! The most flavorful burger I've ever had...and I'm fat. I eat a lot of burgers. Try the pork roll burger, the blue duck fries and the general tso wings. Wow!!!!

This restaurant was outstanding!  I went with a group of 5 for lunch and all were very impressed by the service and quality of food.  I had a 1/2 order of the general Taos wings and I could have licked the plate.  The winds were hot, crunchy and the sauce was amazing.  Another diner had the beast of the northeast and said that she wanted to marry the chef.  Unassuming location with outstanding food!  Thank you!

My boyfriend and I are big fans of this joint. Would give 4.5*

This place definitely feels more home-y, a diner you could imagine walking into back in the day with the stool seating in front of the open kitchen. There are lots of seating for couples, with a couple of tables for bigger groups. It definitely feels a bit awkward being so close to other people bc you can literally hear everything they are saying. 

The food here is so delicious! If you're looking for a unique burger/sandwich, this place delivers! They have the regular burgers like the pork roll, but also have new monthly burgers! I always get the burger of the month because how can you pass up a limited burger :) 

Pork roll burger: 4/5 - my boyfriend loved this burger, while I thought it was good, I preferred what I had ordered.

Chicken fried sandwich: 4.5/5 - I am quite fond of chicken sandwiches (I love chicken in any form). I believe it was one of the monthly burgers, but don't quote me on that.

Steak and Egg burger: 5/5 - Instead of regular ole buns, they had the steak and egg between crescent buns!! probably the best part for me, it was really good and I didn't even order this. 

Grilled chicken w/ chili peppers: 3.5/5 - I thought this was alright. While the chili peppers gave it a great taste, I just didn't like the grilled chicken enough to ever order it again. 

DUCK FAT FRIES: 5/5 - a must order! so good, I love fries and their fries are made perfectly.

The service here is awesome. They're quick and attentive. I'll be back just because my BF loves this place!

Went here for brunch on a Sunday, had a reservation and got seated within ten minutes of arriving. The waitress was awesome and so friendly! She was also very knowledgeable of the menu! Our food came out extremely fast and was delicious! Would highly recommend this place to anyone and I can't wait to go back!

If you are looking for something different to eat in NE philly, this is your place! The blue duck is a delicious and cute little restaurant. I have been here multiple times and had a few burgers and a few of the mac and cheese entrees and I was never disappointed. I have yet to try it for lunch. The service is top notch too. I hope to get back here soon!

Been reading Yelp reviews on Blue Duck Sandwich Company for months before deciding to make a visit for Dinner. 

Today desided to Drop in with few freinds for something to eat. First thing I could think was the great atmosphere. Was seated in less then 2 min by a very polite waitress, This was about 4:30pm. Then I notice about 20 min after sitting down that the servers putting reserved cards on 90% of the Tables. And this is on a Wed night. So if you plan on coming hear for Dinner. Eaither get hear early, or call ahead and make reservations, because the tables fill up fast, and only so many tables inside it's not a huge place, 

The food and quality is what makes this place so popular to eat at. Everything is homemade. And is by far some of the best food you can get in the northeast philly area. 

I got the pork roll burger and duck fries. Both good. Consider getting one order of duck fries for 2 ppl. You get alot. Freinds of mying got the Mac and cheese. And the House Grind Burger. Said everything was good. Next time back like to try the wings. By what I hear they are really good. Didn't have any cheese cake available. So hopefully next time they do so I can give that a try. 

All in All this place is a win win for anyone looking to get a good bite to eat if it's Brunch or Dinner. Do recommend it. 

It's a spot you will see yourself coming back again to eat at. I'll be back to try other things in the near future.

The Blue Duck is a phenomenal addition to the northeast. 

After hearing a ton of rave reviews from friends,  hubby and I decided to try The Blue Duck. We arrived at about 6:30 on a Friday and it was packed, but we still managed to score counter seating after only a short wait.

We were greeted right away and given water to start. We were waiting for 2 friends to join us, so we took some time to check out the decor. The place is actually pretty adorable, with a really on-trend DIY feel- decorative baskets filled with mason jar lids and cute little crates on the walls that look like they could have been repurposed from itty bitty palletes that contained nifty little knicknacks like a bobble head of one of the cooks (not kidding). Basically, if Pinterest were an actual place you could visit, it'd probably be here. 

And the food, oh my goodness. I had the Quack and Cheese, which was mac & cheese with smoked gouda, duck confit, panko bread crumbs and dried cherries. It was everything I'd ever hoped mac & cheese could be. We also split an order of the duck fat fries that were the best I'd ever had (sorry Jose Garces, time to step your game up bro!), and they even reheated great the next day. Hubby had the Blue Duck Sandwich, which I had a taste of and loved. The blueberry bbq sauce was really sweet and delicious, and the Swiss chard gave it plenty of bitterness to contrast. 

It's evident that the menu at The Blue Duck is incredibly well thought out, with each element having its place in their dishes. I also really respect the fact that they somehow manage to use enough restraint to keep their menu simple and approachable. With their great food, comfortable atmosphere and warm accommodating staff, The Blue Duck is definitely going to become one of our regular spots. Thank you for choosing to make NE Philly your home!

This review is based on lunch only. 
When I try some place for the first time, I order the basics. If a restaurant can't do the basics well, I won't order anything else. 
I got the regular mac n cheese which comes with "bacon bits."  The bits were actually large cubes of bacon. Looked great on paper. Not so great tasting. I thought it was a bit too smokey and the bits were chewy and very unappetizing. Would order again without bacon as crazy as it sounds. 
Ordered a burger. Bun was really cold for whatever reason. Burger patty was decent enough. Fries were delicious. 
Friendly service, but had a very long wait time for appetizers. 
Like I mentioned earlier, this is a review for lunch only.  Two stars as it is less than it claims to be.
 I will try dinner.

Disappointed in the time it took to get our order and food. Meanwhile customers well after our arrival ordered and got their food. We had two kids in our party whom suffered because we waited an hour and 15 minutes to for our food. We ordered duck fries which came out timely. I ordered the SFY burger with fries.

Went here after a customer recommended the pork roll burger and the duck fries. The duck fries were awesome and would have been enough! My wife had a special that consisted of pulled pork and avocado quesadilla. Tasted great and on the sweet side, but enjoyable. My burger came out hot with a perfect fried egg on top. The meat was a little off putting because it looked raw, due to the porkroll. Tasted ok, not really beefy or porky. Overall had great service and a good find for a shopping center in NE Philly!

Was in the area and just looked up a place to eat on Yelp. Found this place and decided to check it out. It was packed for brunch, so we sat at the couunter in front of the cooks. Menu was interesting with lots of options. Decided on the chicken and waffles and the duck fries. Food can out fast. The chicken was good. It was missing a little something but it was good nonetheless. The duck fries were amazing. The duck was juicy, not dry or fatty. The fries were double fried, I think, so very crunchy. The cheese sauce was great. Would come back again for this.

4 of us came here for brunch for the first time since it received so many good reviews, but this had to be one of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had. There was a 30 minute wait, which is fine since it was crowded. 30 minutes later, someone comes up to us and tells us our table will be ready, just needs to be cleaned. Then someone else comes up and says it will be a 20 minute wait and that table is now reserved...

20 mins later, they seat us at the bar seats which pissed me off cause I couldnt talk to anyone besides the person next to me. I asked to be moved when a table opens up and our waiter said they'll keep an eye out. I saw a table open right when we sat and they gave it to the 4 top that was waiting behind us (thanks for looking out).... only got worst after that. 

I asked the host if they serve lunch now too. he said yes and gave me a lunch menu when he sat me. I tried to order from the lunch menu and was told they dont serve lunch right now by someone else... We ordered chicken and waffles, it was dry. Duck Benedict, which was served cold and they remade it, when it was remade, it was still cold and eggs were under cooked, dish still wasn't hot. Since i was sitting near the cooks, i saw they cook the duck and let it sit in a plate till its all used up, i saw it sitting for at least 10 minutes. which is why it the duck Benedict kept being cold.

but my friend was tired of waiting and ate it anyways.. Also ordered french toast which was mediocre, nothing special. they removed the duck benedict off the bill which was nice, but still doesn't make up for everything that happened. NEVER going back.

I finally made it to the Blue Duck after hearing great things and reading all the phenomenal reviews on Yelp. So.... it was certainly worth the wait!!  The ambiance was very cool and it felt like we were dining in Old City or Northern Libs,  but we were minutes from home in the heart of the Northeast. For starters we had the Blue Duck fries and they did not disappoint, but seriously they were so flavorful, decadent, yet simple enough for my kids to enjoy. We also had an order of the Blue Moon Citrus wings and you could smell the Blue Moon in the wings and they had an exceptional crisp to them with citrusy sweet flavor that left me wanting more. At this point we've had a bottle of wine and the entrees are hitting the table. We had a pork roll burger ('14 Burger Brawl Champ, '15 Best in Philly Burger), and all I can say is WOW.  The meat blend was outrageous in the patty, spices were on point, and cooked to perfection. A sunny side up egg atop the meaty masterpiece put this sandwich over the top and has taken sole ownership of Best Burger on my list HANDS DOWN! The food was outrageous and the service was good too. The only knock is that they forgot to put in my daughters grilled cheese meal so she had to wait a while for her food, but the owner came over and apologized then removed the meal from our bill. I would highly recommend this place to everyone, oh and it's a BYOB!!!
The blue duck serves very good quality food. I really love the dark here. Next time I'll come here with the whole family so we all can enjoy great food. Awesome service guys wonderful job.

This is probably the best restaurant in the NE. The food is forward-thinking, the ambiance is rustic-chic, and the waitresses are young and sweet. The menu is definitely similar to what you would find in center city- and boy was the NE ready for craft burgers, micro greens, and fois gras. I've eaten here 4 times and have enjoyed every meal. Why 4 stars? The restaurant is so loud! You can't hear yourself think yet alone have a conversation. Best place we dined was at the chefs bar in the back. I would recommend investing in some sound panels! But anyway, we will be back.

I was super excited to try Blue Duck. I grew up in the area and was looking forward to a return trip for something more upscale. I love the idea of not having to go to the city and Blue Duck offers exactly that! We made reservations which are recommended for a Weekend night. The place is small and filled up quickly. There is a standard menu but there were many specials being offered and it was a tough decision! We went with the Philly burger, Fried  Chicken, Duck Fries and Fried cauliflower. All of these were winners! The duck fries had a smoky taste from the Gouda cheese. The duck was perfectly seasoned and the seasoning was spot on! I'm not a fried chicken girl but we tried it because they are known for it. The Sriracha that they soak the chicken in comes through after the first bite. It's initially sweet but then you get that kick. It's not deep fried. It's basically perfectly fried. The cauliflower, now that's deep fried deliciousness. All vegetables should taste this good. This dipping sauce was a flavored mayo. Yum! The burger had a tomato jelly that had a different texture the ketchup. A little rare for my liking but my dinner companion loved it! 

The only down side to me was how close we sat to the next table. A little to close for my liking but we turned this into a positive by making some new friends. 

Our server was attentive, made great recommendations, and made us feel welcome.  Prices were fair. Honestly a little lower then I expected for the quality! 

I'll be back...soon!

Awesome food in the northeast...!!! No need to travel to the city for elevated food. The blue duck fries are can't miss starter. Duck fat fries with Gouda cheese and duck...yes please! Every menu option I have tried has been a home run. The pork roll burger is so good you become sad when it's gone. Big thank you to ownership for opening in the northeast, we need more places like this.

This place falls just short of being a five star venue, but at least they're headed in the right direction.

It's so great to know this place manages to exist in the culinary wasteland that is Northeast Philadelphia. If the crowds are any indication, people are starving for a food experience like they dish out here. Sure, their food can be called typical American fare, but they do it well and they do it uniquely. 

I really only have two major complaints. My biggest complaint is that their coffee is lacking. It kind of just tastes like burnt water, despite being the much loved Rival Brothers brand. I'm not sure if it's how they're brewing it here or the brand itself that isn't good, but don't think I'll ever order another cup of coffee here. Also the size of the restaurant is annoying, and much too small for the crowds that come here. Perhaps a move is in order? I understand that's easier said than done, so take my opinion with a grain of salt. 

However, the food is (mostly) phenomenal. Yes, I've only had brunch in the times I've gone, but I was amazed by how tasty and innovative the meals were and how cheap they were! They have Duck L'Orange pancakes, which are smothered in orange syrup that complements the shredded duck on top nicely. This dish would cost probably 15 dollars were it either in the suburbs or Center City; here it only costs seven dollars! Considering how large the portion was that is a huge discount. If you're hungry for a hearty meal I will suggest the Frankenwaffle, which is a brunch special they don't have all the time. It's a Belgian waffle covered in cheddar cheese, with two slices of scrapple and two sunny side up eggs on top. Sure, it sounds gross, but tastes marvelous. They also have fruity peddles encrusted french toast which is cute and super sugary. It's not my favorite dish but it's alright. I was only truly disappointed with one dish - their breakfast brisket quesadilla. It was underwhelming and just did not play up to the game of the rest of the dishes at this restaurant, so it could definitely use improvement. Let's just say it needed a lot more spice and a bigger portion of pico de gallo to accompany it. 

This review will probably need an upgrade after I experience dinner service, but I can tell you that brunch is at least worth checking out. However, you might want to make a reservation; if you don't get there at 10 o'clock on the dot, you can forget about getting a table. There's some kinks to work out, but overall Blue Duck largely succeeds at what it sets out to do.

This is a one of a kind place. Everything was so delicious! The blue duck fries were probably the best fries I've ever had. Also had the gnocchi, scallops, bolognese, duck Mac and cheese and the pork roll burger. All amazing- especially the pork roll burger! The plating is beautiful, you can tell the chef takes pride in his presentation and ingredients. I look forward to coming back and trying more things!

As my fiance and I try to embark different places to eat brunch every time we get our alone time, we love to come across places that are cozy and friendly. And the Blue Duck is one of those places. So close to home that this just might become one of our top places to add in our favorite brunch restaurants list. We started off with water and coffee and Duck fries. Oh my God thee best fries I've ever eaten in my life needless to say. We could've eaten just that all day long. The wonderful waitress Sara then took our order, kindly refilled our drinks, and suggested the Franken Waffels. As I always like to try new things I went and ordered what Sara recommended and my lady ordered the chicken and waffles. When I tell you that I haven't had a banging ass breakfast better than what I ate... I truly mean it! I was in heaven. Best breakfast/brunch in town hands down. My lady enjoyed hers as well and brought some home. Not only do I give 5 stars to you guys but also 2 thumbs up for the experience and service we came across. Thank you!! You will be having us again.

I went to the Blue Duck for brunch on a Saturday and I am so glad I finally went. I ordered the duck benedict, it was very good but not the largest portion so my hungry self was still hungry. Me and my 2 other friends decided to split the stocks french toast and I am so happy we did because that was perfect portion to split and gave me the sweet treat my taste buds were craving. Definitely try the stocks french toast, it's a must. 

The place wasnt too crowded but it wasnt empty either. We had a reservation so I would suggest making one just to be safe. The service was great too, our waiter was perfect. We had left overs and forget them and he followed us out bringing them to us. 

Super good quality food at an affordable price with great service. You really can't beat it, especially located in the "far" northeast Philadelphia, there arent too many quality places but the blue duck certainly is one of them.

No other place like it in the NE.  My husband and I love coming here for brunch, and never leave without ordering the duck fat fries (SOOOO GOOOOD).  We were just in last weekend for brunch and we love sitting at the counter (also easiest place to get sat at without a reservation)  But you get to watch the cooking happening which is entertaining to us.  We have only BYO'd here on two occasions but the food is a hangover must in my opinion.  Unique choices and always something different on special.  This will definitely remain a brunch spot for us, however dinner did not quite win us over on any of the 3 times we came in for dinner. Just ok, but my husband and I do consider ourselves food snobs because 1. we eat out a lot and 2. we are both good cooks ourselves. 

Definitely worth a try, and don't forget the DUCK FAT FRIES!

I love the quack and cheese, but I feel that the recipe had changed a bit from 2 years ago or maybe then I ordered it without the bread crumbs and dried cherries, but still great food just wish there was more thick duck in my quack and cheese Gouda sauce is still great still I feel something has changed from almost 2 years ago
The food is delicious. The tacos have so many flavors it's like they are battling for your taste buds attention.

The food at this place is excellent! Yet, we didn't have a great first experience. We got the blue duck fries (a must try) the general wings, general tacos and the fried cauliflower. Our food took forever to come out & it wasn't even hot. And the service was terrible! First of all, the hostess didn't even great us properly with a hello, or a welcome or even a smile. And the waitress was no better. She did not smile once and as we were asking questions about the menu she seemed like she was annoyed or in a rush to get away from our table. I'm sorry but if you're a waitress you should be personable, but that's just me. She wasn't pleasant at all & didn't come back to check on us once! We were very disappointed with our first experience and we complained to the manager who apologized for the inconvince and removed the cold dish from our check. He must have said something to our waitress about the complaint because she was a completely different person when she returned to our table. At least she corrected her mistake at the end but this type of service is unacceptable & should not be tolerated. If they don't properly train their staff, this place will be run down to the ground because of poor service. We will defiantly be back to try again because the food was so good but I will make sure to get a different server next time!

I've been to the Blue Duck a few times, including my bridal shower, and every time has been great! I've made it a point to try something different every time I've visited and I have yet to be disappointed. The pork roll burger is delicious and sriracha spicy and VERY messy so be prepared. The fried chicken sandwich is perfectly crispy. The House Grind is juicy and a safe bet for any burger lover out there. The General Tso wings are reminiscent of Korean BBQ wings and the General Tso chicken tacos that my friend had looked yummy too. The Blue Duck fries are a must. I repeat. You MUST get them. All the mac and cheeses are delightful, but I particularly enjoyed the green curry mac and cheese which have a hint of heat and curry flavor and are topped with crispy chickpeas and chicken. But you can't go wrong with any of their velveeta-esque shell mac and cheese. They are BYOB which is always fun when you're prepared and if you aren't they have lemonades, iced teas, and adorable mini glass coke bottles that you can pour into a mason jar. The staff here are so nice and patient, especially when we were there for a few different lunch parties with larger groups. The restaurant is decorated in a light country style which pairs perfectly with the mason jars and galvanized metal wine buckets they provide. I will definitely be returning! The Blue Jawn...I have my eye on you.

Let me start by saying WOW! Yoteeeee that meal was off the meat rack! The duck meatloaf was so properrrrrrr and  the fries were bangeeemon! I was stuffed so I went on voyageee to Pollock and drank a St Ides deuce deuce to celebrate such a bangin spot in the greater northeast. I couldn't help but fall asleep but when I was fully awoke I said to myself i got to tell my mans and them. I called this hitter Maudo and he swung through Sunday for their Orea and ketchup French Toast and said him and his friend Pookie loved it. I can't wait to go next Sunday for that! Love the duck and way they're doing.things.

Has a hipster type of feel despite the fact that the choice of music doesn't quite match the vibe. It was overall an okay brunch experience.

Very little choices on the menu and our waitress forget to mention they also served duck fries until we overheard her say it to a table next to us.

Considering the fact I'm obsessed with eggs Benedict, I obviously ordered the duck Benedict. The food portions are small and if we didn't order the duck fries, I'd still be hungry. But beware the fries are a bit on the heavier side.

The service was good. I wouldn't really recommend this place for brunch but I'll definitely be back to try out the dinner menu.

The Blue Duck is consistently good.  Unique menu with weekly specials.  Prices are a tad bit high for a northeast strip mall location but options are limited in the northeast. The restaurant is very noisy the location has horrible acoustics. They need to add some sound dampeners to improve the situation.  Also they desperately need to change the playlist on their iPod, I like Biggie & The Wu tang clan but I don't feel like listening to it while eating dinner with my parents who are 60 years old.  Two different occasions I was there and they had rap music blaring dropping F bombs etc.

The blue duck is delicious! Their wings are to die for. I love the blue moon flavored wings! Quack n Mac is a must order! I've brought tons of friends to this place from out of states and they all loved it! Hidden gem in Northeast Philly. You don't always have to go to the city for Good food!

Awesome, Awesome, and more Awesome.  Pork Roll Burger is Banggin, Gen Tso's Wings are the bomb, and The Sunday brunch is where it's at.  The Fried Chicken and Waffles shouldn't be passed up on!  Definitely a must visit restaurant.   I only listed my absolute fav's.

Their main location closed without much notice. I have neighbors who had reservations and went to the restaurant only to find out the place was closed. 

Now I'm stuck with a gift card that I never got to finish using for this restaurant. Live & learn

 The original chef who was fired last fall has moved to northeast sandwich company in fox chase. I will be taking myself there to enjoy the brisket Mac and cheese the way only he could make it.

Just enjoyed dinner with the wife and the food was very well prepared and tasty...duck fries are awesome, the freshly made burger was really good, I have to give a shout out to the waitress, she was really attentive to our needs...really nice place to eat and relax, next time I'll bring wine....great job
Great service! Great food! Hidden gem for sure.. duck fries are a must! Definately going back

So this is the hipster place to eat in NE. 
Seems a little out of place too. 
Needs to be in Northern Liberties or something. 
The prices are kinda high especially for the location I fell. 

I'm not a huge duck fan but the duck fries so they don't seem like amazing to me. 
My GF loves there turkey burger. 
I almost always get pork roll burger. 
The wings are good but do not get many. 

If it was not for the surprise special deserts which they run out of every day I would of given three stars. Dessert is a must there. 
Still never been there for brunch which I heard was great.

This place is the best for a burger. Definitely a gem in the neighborhood. I suggest coming during the weekday when it's a bit slow so you can enjoy your food in peace, because on the weekends it gets pretty crowded and you have to make a reservation otherwise you will not get a seat. The restaurant is very small and has a home type of feel but offers gourmet styled food. I absolutely love this place and I highly recommend trying it!

July 2017 I love the quack and cheese, I ordered it without the bread crumbs and dried cherries, but still great food just wish there was more thick duck in my quack and cheese Gouda sauce is still great still I feel something has changed from almost 2 years ago

Nov 2017 I want the recently maybe a couple weeks ago, and I had them quack and cheese and it was phenomenal! I love it so much, I brought a colleague from dental sales with me to go and share the experience! this time there was plenty of duck and Gouda sauce!! Love it!
Delicious/creative menu, good service, minimal brunch wait time. Can't wait to try their dinner menu!

This place is typically amazing. I don't have a bad word to say about their normal menu,everything is fantastic. However, there're pop up Italian day today (Monday the 7th of November) was horrible.  Not one good thing to say about it. Food was just ok. Mainly bland and flavorless. I think they should stick to what their good at. Don't change a great thing.
This kind of feels like a place you would see in Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. The potato croquettes were real good, and everything else was fine.

went on Saturday for brunch was looking forward to is since I had heard good things  I wasnt very impressed had chicken and waffles  the waffles were cold and the chicken was rather dry  nothing special  the worst part was they served the food with no utensils  when they did bring the utensils we had to ask for napkins  also one of us ordered potatoes on the side which didn't arrive until she was half way done her meal.  I think they may be overrated because of the lack of competition in the northeast.

Where do I start. I ordered food to go it was my first time here so I ordered the Blue Jawn  burger no lie  I vomited we had to hurry up and pull over. I ordered the general tso chicken tacos not good and the sauce was too sweet. They were using bare hands to prepare the food which was already a turn off. The place is small and tight everything is everywhere. My 3 year old daughter brung me spray bottles I guess they had in her sight. The Mac and cheese were like baby elbow and partially hard . Looks are very deceiving, everything looks good but I wasn't happy.My baby didn't even like her Mac and she love Mac and cheese and my son love General tso chicken but not this one. I will not be returning ever. The prices were very high too.The food was being prepared or put together after food was cooked at least when a pizza goes in the oven  and bake it kills the germs.You'll do everything bare hand. No sarcasm needed. Thank you Nick

Having two kids under 4, we don't get out too often.  However, when we do, we try and make our dinner plans worth the cost and trouble of finding s babysitter. Hands down our dinner at The Blue Duck was the best meal we have had in quite some time.  We ate at an incredibly reputable restaurant in Center City, just last week, and this meal blew it away.  The highlight of the meal was the Brussels Sprouts appetizer with noodles, which was so good, that my wife immediately told our waitress that we needed to take home two additional orders for the next day.  Thank you to all at The Blue Duck for a wonderful meal and to our waitress for fantastic service. We will certainly be back...with family in tow.

This place was so so incredible. We went for brunch and enjoyed the heck out of everything. I got the duck benedict and it was so beautifully plated and delicious. They gave a generous amount of duck meat as well. They had some unique wing flavors and we tried some blue moon ones to share and the blue duck fries. Sooo worth any stomach heaviness after. Everything was perfect. 

The decor is crazy adorable, servers attentive and friendly, and byo. If you find yourself in this odd shopping center of a location, go get your duck on.

The blue duck fries (in the middle with the cheese on top) are a must. I know a lot of reviews say to get it, which might make people skeptical. But believe me and whatever they say about the fries. Blue duck fries can be a meal itself if you have a small appetite. There are some fries with more salt that others but its a seasoning no big deal. 
Now if you like me and need a little more. Sure order either the quack n cheese OR burger (I got smoked bbq pork). Ordering both is way too much. I thought I could handle it. 
Quack n cheese (green bowl) has portobello mushroom, scallion, dried cherries. 
Smoke bbq pork is served on potato bread. The salty from the fries goes well with the pickles. 
Happy with my choices. Left bloated 

Update: quake n cheese w/ fries is too much to handle. My family tried to pass me the burgers, nope. I was already full.

This is a gem of a restaurant in Northeast Philadelphia. After being  inundated with   pizza and pizza steak joints, it's about time we have some fine dining. IMO, The cost was very reasonable. It is a BYOB so you can bring whatever you like. Ice buckets. uncorking, and appropriate glasses are provided free of charge. We shared two different appetizers which were very good. We had duck ravioli and fried wings with the wasabi blue cheese sauce which was not too hot. That's good for me as I don't like wasabi that burns your mouth. The meals were excellent. I had the duck which was covered in a sesame breadcrumbs and was cooked perfectly. My son had a veal chop and said his was cooked just he expected. My daughter-in-law had the boar burger and ate it very quickly so it had to be as delicious as she said it was. Reservations are needed. I highly recommend the Blue Duck and cannot wait to go back again.

This place is cute small and cozy. I almost thought they would have no seats for us. The menu is small but some very good options for different flavors. I had fried chicken which they give you a lot of chicken it comes with Mac and cheese which is tastyyy but unfortunately in a small cup. My bf had a Cesar salad but it was small and had a weird taste. I did not like that. But the service was great! May come back for a burger

Forget the good reviews regarding the food, first you have to get into the place. We were a party of 8 with reservations for 7pm this past Thursday. We all arrived at 6:50pm and let the host know. Waited outside in the cold for 20 minutes, then checked again with host. He stated they had a large party that would not leave and that was going to be our table. OK, we waited some more as we watched others (2's and 4's) enter and were seated. At 7:50pm we again went in and asked, sorry they said, the table is still occupied. We were now cold & hungry. Told the manager we were going somewhere else. He never apologized, offered a certificate for another time, nothing, nada, nil. Don't believe we will ever return. They just overbook and the hell with you.
Great place. Cozy atmosphere. Delicious food. LOOOOOVE the quack and cheese. Attractive waiters who give great service especially the tall dark and handsome one with the Bernie shirt .

The noisiest restaurant I have ever been in. It felt like you were dining in a tin can. Every time someone got up to leave the chairs rattled a huge noise throughout the  restaurant. Probably due to the concrete floor and low ceiling. We were never so happy to leave a restaurant due to the tremendous noise level! We couldn't even her the waitress tell us about the specials. 

The fried chicken was crunchy and tasty but a tad dried out. No juicy chicken here. The French fries were dark and a tad soggy. 

The Mac and cheese was very good. No apple or orange juice available for the little ones.

I was here for the first time for a late lunch with a friend (on a Saturday). It's a pretty small restaurant and was fairly busy. We were seated at the counter since we were hungry and didn't want to wait for a table to open up, which was perfectly fine with us. We ordered Bruschetta Wings, Blue Duck Fries, and the B.B.B.L.T Sandwich to share. The wings were okay, flavorful but didn't get the taste of bruschetta at all... Confused on that one. The Duck Fries were DELICIOUS! And the sandwich had generous amounts of bacon (thick applewood and smoked bacon). Overall we enjoyed our meal and will definitely be back... Most likely to try the brunch menu (available on Sundays only). Service was great, waitress was friendly, and came back often to check up on us.

I had the portobello black bean/corn salsa sandwich it was very yummy!! 
The restaurant is really cute and clean inside, not what you would expect from something in a strip mall!

Have been waiting to try this place since it opened but every time I've gone there's been some crazy wait. My mom and I finally made it there on Tues night and loved it. 

I got the chipotle chicken taco special and they were amazing, bigger than I thought they would be. My mom got a duck entree which turned out to be pasta with red sauce (she didn't know, whoops). The ginger mango tea on special was so delicious as well. Obviously the highlight of my meal were the blue duck fries. I would easily just go and order them from now on for myself. So goooooddddd. 

Our waiter was super friendly and attentive. Great service. Can't wait to go back and try the pork roll burger!!

Duck Fat Fries!!!! I absolutely loved these here. Huge portion with so much flavor - you definitely need a fork for this dish.

This restaurant really stands out in a neighborhood of pizza joints and delis - it does look out of place.  But word travels fast, and judging by the crowded dining area and full parking lot, I'm not the only one that made a trip to try Blue Duck.

Besides duck, they seem to also specialize in wings and mac and cheese, as they offer a variety of housemade sauces and styles. Mac and cheese dish is made with shells, which I thought I wouldn't like. But I was proven wrong. Very flavorful and the shells really carry the cheese sauce well into my mouth.

The wings were crispy and the blue cheese was excellent. Not the best wings i've ever had, but still good.

I SHOULD'VE gotten their famous Blue Jawn burger like I planned, but opted for an off-menu special - some grounded duck burger. While it was good and I really tasted the duck in the ground meat, it was too well for me and it definitely didn't satisfy my burger craving. Good nonetheless, just not a hamburger replacement. Also, the burger did NOT come with fries.  Weird.

But it's not like I could've eaten more fries after the Blue Duck fries. That was definitely my fave of the night - melted cheese, fresh cut fries, duck confit. It was divine, and I would come back solely for these fries.

If you like duck in the least, you should definitely make a visit here. And don't forget to bring a bottle or two: it is BYOB.

They need more of these types of restaurants in the northeast! Local BYOB spot with great food and ambience. They're always packed but you can always find a spot at the counter and watch the cooks work their magic. Their duck fries are a must have and can't ever go wrong with the fried chicken or one of their burgers/sandwiches.

UPDATE: Dined here this past weekend and the food was seriously under seasoned. The fried cauliflower was bland, the steak needed salt and the house salad needed more acidity. My friend ordered the buffalo chicken tacos and it was dry (no amount of hot sauce could save them). Love the environment here and hope this was just an off night!

These guys are hidden away in the Northeast and are KILLING IT. Love the food, and love the vibe. Totally relaxed, but serving up food that I would argue is better than any other gastropub in center city. Keep it up!

I love the quack and cheese but then I ordered it without the bread crumbs and dried cherries, but still great food just wish there was more thick duck in my quack and cheese Gouda sauce is still great still I feel something has changed from almost 2 years ago

This place has been picking up quite a few good reviews. ......we were greated at the front door by a very friendly gentleman. .....as we were seated we were again greeted by our waitress......all of the staff is very friendly. .....I forgot to say this was lunch time in NE philly.......the dining area is full......she told us the specials and we tried the Duck Fries for a starter......we both ordered and really enjoyed our lunch.. ..they work very hard and we're very attentive. ....  this was a new place for us to try and we will be back......it is also a byob.......it was recommended that we get reservations for dinner.  .. job well done by all.......we will be back. ...
