This place is great, really tasty foods. I had the duck benedict which was really tasty but a bit too small. The poutine is the hit here, and the wings appear to be worth a return trip. They do a pretty busy breakfast / brunch business, the place is packed.....and sort of small. It's really clean and the guys cooking are really friendly. We both want to go back to try some other things an the menu.

Best center city style brunch joint in Northeast Philly.
You have to try their duck...amazing. I also must give props to their superb customer service.  I always tip the Blue Duck waiters over 20% because they simply deserve it.

I had such high hopes.... and left feeling meh... after seeing the Instagram page and reading the Yelp reviews, my expectations were high. But truth be told I was not impressed. 

We came for dinner. It is in the middle of a shopping mall and you must make a reservation as the restaurant is small. We were about ten minutes early and it was too soon to sit so we waited outside. Be prepared to stand to wait as there is no waiting area. Once we were seated we began to explore the menu. It is byob. We ordered the BBQ wings, buffalo wings, duck fries, and brussel sprouts as appetizers. The wings were ok... the Buffalo sauce had a hint of lime.. not sure how I felt about that. The fries and brussel sprouts were just average. 

For my meal I had the fried chicken. It was a decent portion and was drizzled with honey. Again it was average nothing special. It comes with a small side of Mac and cheese. I didn't hate the food I just didn't love it. I felt like everything was lacking flavor and the food was kind of pricy for what you were getting. 

Also, we were a group of five and we were seated at a pretty small table and yet we literally couldn't hear each other. Nobody at my table talked because for some reason it was so loud that night. 

Overall I just didn't see the hype and wouldn't go out of my way again to come. Maybe brunch is a better experience.

Love this place! Been there 3 times and loved each time. Originally not from the area when my family came to visit I brought them here, there was something for everyone. My mom loved the specials and my nieces loved thier Mac and cheese. Service was good they are always busy but make sure you have everything you need

My first time here and it was pretty busy at lunch. Decided to sit at the counter rather than wait for a table. Service was terrific, very friendly and attentive. I had the Blue Duck sandwich which was duck with blueberry infused BBQ sauce. Tasty! They also have a large side of fries. I would definitely eat here again.
Atmosphere is quint. Service as good. Food was different than I'm used to, but delicious. Overall great experience

Great food! Ordered the Quack and Cheese for an appetizer and I'm still thinking about it. The Porkroll Burger was amazing. Beef patty with ground porkroll mixed in... yum! 
The service was great too. The only thing that kinda turned me off was that we were sitting literally 4 inches from the table next to us and the server had to hand food over my head to their table.

My first time here was actually a Sunday brunch takeout order. I'm sure the meal would have been even better if it had been eaten at the location BUT it was still amazing brought home. The only complaint any of us had was that pickles were put in the container for the porkroll burger, making the bun soggy. The plus side was the burger itself was so delicious it was hard to even focus on the soggy bun aspect. We tried the porkroll burger, porkroll egg rolls, fruity pebble French
Toast, salt & pepper fries, and strawberry & banana pancakes. All phenomenal, would recommend all the meals and of course those delicious fries with cheese sauce. Can't wait till our next brunch here (hopefully dining in)!

Went here for my birthday Jan 16th 2016.
The place was crowded. You need to make reservations. 

Table was ready by our reservation time.

Food was great I had their seafood stew. Which reminds me more of an Italian seafood pasta without the presence of cheese. I also shared a serving of their brisket mac and cheese it had little slices of jalapeños on it that gave it this extra zing. 
My boyfriend had the pork roll burger. He loved it. It didn't come with fries though and it was kinda small. He enjoyed it immensely and said it was satisfying regardless of the size.

Since it was my birthday they gave me a complimentary piece of cake. It was a whiskey honey cake. It was just delicious you could taste the whiskey but it was so buttery. 

I can't wait to go back.

While checking your GPS to navigate through the Northeast, keep your eyes peeled for a small restaurant right in the middle of a small shopping plaza. Don't judge the book by its cover yet, because the reviews are right: it's totally worth it. 

It was a hot Saturday morning but I took the pup and my girlfriends and I sat outside under the shade, which was nice. We were surprised by how many specials the waitress had to read us. They all sounded amazing. Quickly, we realized we all wanted to try the duck fat fries, so that became our appetizer (at 10:30am, no less). They were probably some of the best fries I've ever had. Topped with delicious melted REAL cheese, shredded duck and scallions, the fries were also perfectly fried to a nice texture. 

As for our brunch entrees, I went with the frankenwaffle special, which was a savory bacon waffle with homemade scrapple and fried eggs. After the fries, I figured Blue Duck would be a good place to try scrapple for the first time. Is it supposed to be really mushy in the center? It seemed very thick-cut, and I wished for more of the fried outer layer. The waffle also could have used more of a bite but it was rather soft. But the flavors were all good with a dab of sriracha. 

My friend got the duck benedict, which looked amazing, but the dish was on the smaller side so I felt bad asking for a bite. My other friend got the chicken and waffles, in which she also enjoyed the chicken more than the soft waffle (made softer by loads of syrup). Tip: order syrup on the side. 

We would definitely come back and try some of the other things on the menu, especially their sandwiches that looked really good. With a side of those DUCK. FAT. FRIES.

Family outing to The Blue Duck for breakfast Sunday. We showed up without making reservations and thought we wouldn't be able to be seated. The hostess took care of us and seated us at the counter in front of the cook which was great. We placed our drink orders and looked over the menu. The missus suggested we try the blue duck fries. She ordered the short rib and egg quesadilla. Me and my younger son both ordered one of the specials a waffle infused with bacon topped with scrapple, sunny side up eggs and cheese sauce. My other son ordered the chicken and waffles.

The missus said the short rib and egg quesadilla was a large portion and tasty. You may want to request additional sour cream and salsa on the side. Nice breakfast twist since it has egg in it! 

My son said the Belgian waffles were light and fluffy. Was dissapointed the fried chicken had a sweet flavor to it when I was looking for savory notes to compliment the maple syrup/waffles.

The blue duck fries were amazing! Hand cut fries tossed in duck fat, smoked Gouda cheese sauce and shredded duck confit with scallions. 

The special was delicious also. The waffle was light and fluffy, however I didn't taste the bacon. The scrapple was prepared well not overly fried. The sunny side up eggs and the cheese sauce tied everything together. 

I will definitely be back to try the wings and the burgers!

Came in a Sunday afternoon. They were our of an ingredient in both of the dishes that we chose. Not that big of a deal because the dishes that we did end up getting were fantastic. My pork roll burger was a treat. Service was timely amd friendly. Next time we'll have to grab some duck fries.

Love this place hands down the best in the northeast. It's like a center city restaurant located in the northeast.  The duck fries are to die for. (I think I'll order some now). Best part is that the food is extremely reasonable - so you get Center city quality food for northeast Philly prices (way cheaper and you don't have to make the drive down CC. There is a daily changing menu to keep the food fresh and keep me coming back for the new specials I haven't tried yet. 

These owners actually did open a center city and old city location after the success of this gem i. The northeast. - the northeast has been wanting a place like this and the owners knocked it out of the park.  

Make sure you call and make a reservation as the place is tiny and there is never an empty seat.

If there is a finer food experience in NE Philadelphia,  please let me know. Whether for lunch, dinner, or brunch, I've yet to try anything that wasn't delicious. It's a small place, so reservations are a good idea. The room is bit loud, but so what. The ever-changing specials keep me coming back on an almost weekly basis, and it's a BYOB which I consider a plus. Inventive and creative, this is my favorite restaurant.

This is a one of a kind place. Everything was so delicious! The blue duck fries were probably the best fries I've ever had. Also had the gnocchi, scallops, bolognese, duck Mac and cheese and the pork roll burger. All amazing- especially the pork roll burger! The plating is beautiful, you can tell the chef takes pride in his presentation and ingredients. I look forward to coming back and trying more things!

Amazing food, seriously amazing. Every time I come to this part of Philly I go to Holme Circle to eat here. There is a minor problem, though: incredibly slow but sweet staff. I mean I've seen them comp a $75 tab because the cooks were slow. Takes forever to get out of there once you're done. And the manager just walks around scoping out the dining room and doesn't help at all. I'd be annoyed AF if he was my boss. But it's so worth it for that food. Mac and Cheese, those fries, the bread, and the duck: man, this place will fill you up.

This place is a surprise gem!  In an unassuming strip mall in Northeast Philadelphia, this place was packed the whole time we were there (Saturday afternoon).  We had to order for someone with allergies to wheat, dairy, and eggs - they were able to have a delicious burger on a gluten free bun.  No fuss about accommodating the allergies.  Our group ordered duck fries, wings, two sandwiches, and macaroni and cheese as well.  Everything was delicious and the service was fantastic.  Additionally, they are extremely kid friendly.  We had two babies with us and saw three other families with babies and small children in the restaurant at the same time.

I especially love this restaurant because it feels like a restaurant you would find in Center City or Northern Liberties - but it's in the Northeast.  We need more places like this!  I would highly recommend you try this restaurant.  Especially if you like duck.

Food: 4
Decor: 3
Ambiance: 3
Service: 3.5
Value: 4

BYOB is a plus. Location, not so much. But unique and delicious food is to be had here.
9https://goo.gl/imageshttps://goo.gl/images/poHCPKminshyhiiill/mpoHCPKminshiyihi 8th yi i 9uni 8hours

I am still on the fence with this one. I only had duck 1 time prior to coming here so I wasn't sure what to expect. The atmosphere was nice but cramped. The tables will require you to get intimate with strangers as they feel like they are sitting with you. I thought the menu was a bit overpriced, but I guess duck costs more here than in China town?? We started with the duck fries which were delicious, then we moved onto the quack and cheese and Brussel sprouts, and finished with the wild boar burger. I must say that the tomato jam on the boar burger had a fantastic flavor that offset the taste perfectly the quack and cheese just became too much duck and I couldn't eat much of it. Overall the place is decent but the duck for every course gets old for me.

My first time here and I was blown away. A co-worker of mine had suggested for lunch, and I was so glad he did. The minute I walked in the front door, I was greeted with smiles. Immediately got seated (which we totally lucked out, as it got packed soon after). Everything on the menu sounded delicious and I honestly had a hard time deciding. I went with the Fried Chicken Sandwich and OMG was it tasty. I am completely in love with this cute chic-country style restaurant and will definitely recommend it to everyone! 

Shall out to our server Melvin Brener for being soooooooo amazing and making my first experience GREAT!

I ate here with my mom and my daughter. We started off with the duck fries. I had the sweet potato gnocchi, my mom had the portabella burger(she got it on a wrap instead of the bun) and my daughter got the porkroll burger.I loved the duck fries would definitely recommend them, they were cooked just right with great flavor. The gnocchi was good and flavorful as well just a very small portion size. The porkroll burger was definitely a work of art for a burger lover, I was skeptical about the egg but it did complete the sandwich, very rich, only complaint is the bun was not manly enough for that burger!!!! The portabella has this sauce of black bean corn salsa, braised kale and red roasted aoli that had amazing flavor. We had the ginger mango tea, which was the special drink of the day, it was pretty good, I think the pitcher should have been stirred better, ginger taste was a lil strong, came unsweetened which is fine but that was not told to us before receiving our tea. We got the funnel cake(can't remember the name of it) for dessert and it was just O K it was really doughy inside. The staff was super friendly and accommodating and the entire place was clean(even the restroom). My only major complaint was that the chairs were EXTREMELY uncomfortable!!! Overall, this place is super cute and the flavors are blended perfectly just the portion sizes are SMALL and so is the restaurant for the crowd sizes it attracts. I definitely think like any new business they are going to experience some growing pains but I'm glad a place like this is now in the NE and can't wait to try more menu items.

Saturday morning, we called to see how long the wait was for a table the lady said 15-20 mins someone is leaving soon and she can squeeze us in.. My boyfriend and I said great, we're on our way now. I live 20 mins away so it worked out. Once we got to the restaurant, my boyfriend told the hostess his name and the hostess said it's a 40 mins wait after we told her we just called and the lady said there's a table for us reserved. We ended up sitting at the counter.. it was raining and we're hungry so we just stayed. Sitting at the counter was very sad.. we were staring at the wall.

Our server was attentive and answered all our questions. Duck fries were amazing, we finished the whole thing. Our burgers were very big and juicy. However, it did take a very long for our burgers to come out. The couple next to us came in later then us and got their food before us.

I've read a few reviews before, and I haven't had the experience with the service that has been criticized.Our waitress, Liz, was fantastic and as she moved through the restaurant I watched her check the tables as she walked through. She was attentive and her recommendations are spot on! Nick, the general manager, is what you want to see in a general manager. My husband made our reservations on open table and Nick remembered it was our 19th anniversary and presented a complimentary slice of chocolate cake for our special day! It was rich, chocolatey and incredible. The food is delicious and if your not sure what to get, take the suggestion from your wait staff because they really know the menu. We started with the Duck Fries and potatoes croquettes. Both were delicious. My husband ordered the pork roll burger and loved it. I ordered the chicken parm tacos-the chicken was fried to perfection and had a wonderful balance of cheese and sauce (Liz's recommendation and glad I got it). It does get noisy, but I'm used to that from restaurants in Center City. The chefs behind the open kitchen are excellent and add pizzaz as they're preparing the food.Total for 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, iced tea, dessert milkshake-plus tip-70.00. A must try restaurant!  The Northeast has needed a restaurant like this for a long time and I'm so happy it's here! Try the milkshakes-heaven! Welcome Blue Duck and we'll be back!!

This is a gem of a restaurant in Northeast Philadelphia. After being  inundated with   pizza and pizza steak joints, it's about time we have some fine dining. IMO, The cost was very reasonable. It is a BYOB so you can bring whatever you like. Ice buckets. uncorking, and appropriate glasses are provided free of charge. We shared two different appetizers which were very good. We had duck ravioli and fried wings with the wasabi blue cheese sauce which was not too hot. That's good for me as I don't like wasabi that burns your mouth. The meals were excellent. I had the duck which was covered in a sesame breadcrumbs and was cooked perfectly. My son had a veal chop and said his was cooked just he expected. My daughter-in-law had the boar burger and ate it very quickly so it had to be as delicious as she said it was. Reservations are needed. I highly recommend the Blue Duck and cannot wait to go back again. Added: the brunch menu is also better than average. Prices are reasonable. About $5 for hotcakes with the topping. This place just keeps increasing the quality of its food.

The fact that I haven't written a review of Blue Duck yet is a horrific travesty. I must correct this.

Blue Duck Sandwich Company is the undisputed leader in changing the Northeast Philly Dining Scene.If NE Philly is the old school Scottish army, then Blue Duck is  William Wallace (in the leadership element and not really the whole getting disemboweled thing). 

The burgers are fabulous. The Duck fries are fabulous. The real secret winner here, honestly, is the quack n' cheese - This jawn combines salty, sweet, savory, meaty, and horrifically unhealthy to create my favorite mac n cheese dish in Philly.

Go.

I'm so glad to have such a wonderful restaurant in the community. New and refreshing. I've had the pork roll burger which is out of this world!!! The general tso wings amazing!! The first time I went they had a delicious mint iced tea, please make that again!! I'm a huge iced tea fan so when I see different teas it makes me so happy. Keep up the great work!

I came here for breakfast and was really impressed by my cinnamon sugar waffles. They were sorta like fried waffles? Hard to explain but delicious to eat.  My  3 star review was from the poor service. Even with an empty restaurant (there might have been one or two other tables occupied) service was slow and forgetful.

I am excited that there is a restaurant like Blue Duck Sandwich Company in North East Philly.  Living closer to downtown there so many awesome restaurant options but in the North East where I work it's mostly chains restaurants or less than exciting pizza/bar food type places.  Now getting my co-works to branch out of just a basic salad or sandwich can be challenging at times.  But despite their preference for boring food choices they seem to be ok with the small and unique menu offered at Blue Duck Sandwich Company.  And one of them actually frequents the place regularly.

Love the décor of the place has a very farm to table feel to it.  It's very bright inside; the only issue I have is that both times we went it's been extremely cold to the point where I debated eating with my coat on.  They were out of their signature sandwich and the produce truck hadn't come so no tomatoes for the bbblt on our second visit which was a little disappointing since two of us planned to try the blue duck sandwich.

The Blue Duck Fries honestly could be a meal in itself, there huge the 1st time the 4 of us split them the second time I went I actually just got it as a meal neither time were they all finished.  I've tried both the bruschetta wing and general tso, both were nice and crispy but the general tso were infinitely better.  Two of my co-works are picky about Chicken Salad and raved about the club, so if you're picky too this one might be worth a try.  I really enjoyed the portabella burger the roasted red pepper aoli really topped it off.  Both the fried chicken sandwich and quack & cheese looked yummy.  If you're not into cheese the cheese on the salt and pepper fires comes on the side.  It's a different sauces from the blue duck fires both are tasty I can decided which I like better probably leaning towards the one on the blue duck fires.

I finally made it to The Blue Duck, and it was worth the car ride to the northeast. The restaurant is situated in a shopping center with very uniform looking signage for all of its stores. Inside, the restaurant is bright and sweetly decorated with cool lighting fixtures and pretty wall art. 

It was around 2pm on a Saturday but there were still several tables full for lunch. We ordered the blue duck fries and a couple sandwiches. The fries arrived before the sandwiches - a good thing because we were super hungry. Said fries were covered in melted cheese sauce and shredded duck. Somehow, they were also still crunchy. Best fries I've had in a while. 

There was quite a bit of time before our sandwiches arrived, which is fine, but this is when I started wishing we had brought some beer along. Mental note for next time! I opted for the fried chicken sandwich but requested a wheat wrap. It was delicious! The ranch dressing from the coleslaw had a slightly sweeter flavor than I was expecting but it was very tasty. The chicken was excellent. My fiancé's grilled chicken sandwich with pimento cheese and bacon was also great. 

Already looking forward to my next visit, definitely with some brews in tow!

The Blue Duck is the cutest restaurant I've ever been too. Right when you walk in you feel a bubbly vibe from all of the staff welcoming you to come sit down and eat there delicious food. The menu is perfect because it's not too overwhelming like other restaurant's menus..some of the meals titles gave me a laugh as well such as the "The quack and cheese" lol made me giggle. The fries though......amazing, the Mac and cheese...to die for. And when I got my burger I died and went to heaven. This restaurant was just perfect I will definitely be back all of the time. I definitely recommend coming here to eat. I heard the brunch is amazing too I'm going to have to come on a Sunday and try it for myself!

If you're looking for fast, hipster-esque, delicious comfort food, you've found it.  This place is incredible. They are famous for their duck fries which are fries covered in duck meat, this cheesy gravy stuff and scallions.  They are amazing. It make the clogged arteries you're going to get from them completely worth it.  
I got the FSY sandwich which was a turkey burger, cheese, bacon, and avocado. I asked them to hold the haberno mayo and they forgot that part. I scraped it off but when my sister and I went, we were the only people there. So it's not like they forgot because they were too busy to listen, just they didn't remember. 
My sister got the buffalo cauliflower burger that she said was incredible as well.
 It is small there- so on a weekend, it's probably best to call ahead. But my main problem is that it was so expensive!  Two sandwiches and a thing of fries was $50.  It was so good though. Just remember- you were warned!

Hands down my favorite brunch spot in the Northeast!

You can't go wrong with a BYOB - so make sure you bring a bottle or two for your meal. My favorite dishes are the blue duck fries and general tso's chicken wings. I'm pretty sure I spilt the blue duck fries every time I go :)

Tip: Make sure you make a reservation for brunch unless you're okay with sitting at the counter

I wish there was a 4.5 rating. Every dinner I had was a 5 star- expertly seasoned and tender meat with great side dishes. Breakfast menu is limited. I had duck Benedict. Duck was seasoned and cooked nicely. Egg was poached. It was served over a soft potato roll that absorbed the egg yolk. Felt like I needed toast or a toasted English muffin for dipping before the roll got my yolk.

I've been here 3-4 times and every single time has been excellent. Please note, I've only ever gone for Sunday brunch. My boyfriend and I always share a plate of duck fries to start and every time say we should just eat that because it is so good and satisfying. This go around he got the duck benedict, which he said was good but not very filling. There was only 1 half of the biscuit. I got the brunch special of the day - The Frankenwaffle. Bacon waffle (yes bacon in the waffle) topped with scrapple, 2 eggs and cheese sauce. It was occasionally sweet, but mostly savory and 100% delicious. If that's an option when you go there for brunch, I highly recommend it. The Blue Duck is only open 10-3 on Sundays for brunch, and its BYOB so bring some OJ and champagne and have mimosas like we did!
Great food, great service & always on point. Finally a place in the NE with great food & atmosphere! A must for brunch.

I was looking for some place to have lunch with my daughter and parents and my sister and her 3 children and we decided on The Blue Duck. I had heard many people rave about this restaurant so we figured we would give it a try.
My mum and I ordered the turkey burger with bacon, cheddar cheese and avocados and I must say not only was it HUGE but it was also delicious! My daughter loved her Mac and cheese and fries. The fries were a bit too salty to my taste but still pretty good. My dad had the beast of the northeast, my nieces all split burgers and my sister had the hummus chicken wrap. Everyone mentioned numerous times how delicious the food was. 
The only negative about the experience is that it is so damn loud inside there. They keep the radio like all the way up. My dad had to step outside after he was done eating and wait for us to finish because he couldn't handle the noise level so forget about having a conversation in there. For this I took one star away. The food is banging though so keep that up but please turn the volume down.

Staff was not friendly or accommodating to people of color and uninformed about the market that they serve. Their website is difficult to navigate for reservations. Looks great online but beware of the hoops you'll have to go to get a seat.

I came here with a party of eight for a holiday dinner! We were seated right around our reservation time and were promptly offered water and our drink order was taken. The menu has many delicious options and they were able to make accommodations for the vegetarians in our group! The food was absolutely delicious. Everyone in our group loved their order and we were all trying bites from one another. The salt and pepper fries were some of the best fries I've had!

Will definitely be coming back

WOW!  I really enjoyed this place. 

We ordered Fried Cauliflower, Blue Duck Fries, and Quack & Cheese to share.
My friend and I share the General Tso's wings (a little too sweet for me) and House Grind Burger

My Faves:
The Fried Cauliflower was amazing, with a soft, mashed potato texture and a outer crispy breading. 
House Grind Burger was juicy and flavorful.  no need for ketchup or any extra frills
Blue Duck Fries
Love this place! Food is always good-we always take out of town guests here because the atmosphere is cool and the foods excellent.
